14:50:00 27JUL25, Understood—thanks for clarifying the scope; we're treating the Cockpit with PCP setup strictly as an optional add-on front-end for NVIDIA GPU monitoring, separate from the core Nosana host installation script. This keeps things modular, so the monitoring layer can be layered on post-Nosana setup without interference. Based on the provided HTML content, I'll outline a high-level plan for the dedicated Cockpit installation/modification script, adapting it for Ubuntu 24.04 Server with a single-run, non-rebooting approach (commenting out any reboot commands during testing). The goal is a bash script that handles prerequisites, installations, builds, configurations, and verifications in sequence, assuming NVIDIA drivers are pre-installed (as per the HTML's emphasis on checking them first), and focusing on single-GPU for now to simplify.

Key adaptations from the HTML to fit our mission:

Single script, no intermediate reboots: We'll sequence everything linearly—check/install drivers if needed (but warn if a reboot is typically required, and comment it out), enable universe repo, install backported cockpit and dependencies, build PCP 6.3 from source with NVIDIA PMDA, enable services, set persistence mode, verify metrics, and add the custom Cockpit extension. Any potential reboot points (e.g., after driver install) will be commented with a note like "# reboot # Commented for testing; uncomment for production if drivers were installed."
Error handling and idempotency: Add checks (e.g., if package is already installed) to make it re-runnable without issues, and include echo statements for progress/logging.
Versioning and timestamp: Script starts with version (e.g., echo "Version 0.00.0 - $(date '+%H:%M:%S %d%b%y')") as the first output line.
Assumptions: Single GPU; Ubuntu 24.04 Server clean install; user runs as root or with sudo; NVIDIA GPU present. No Nosana-specific integrations since it's add-on only.
Planned script structure outline:

Header/Version: Print version and timestamp.
Prerequisites Check/Install:
Verify NVIDIA driver (nvidia-smi check; if missing, install from repo but comment reboot).
Enable universe repo.
Install dev libs (e.g., autoconf, libtool, etc.) and other deps like cuda-toolkit if needed.
Cockpit Installation: Use backported version from PPA or direct install as per HTML.
PCP Build and Install:
Download PCP 6.3 source.
Configure with --with-nvidia=yes.
Build and install (handle potential errors like missing deps by pre-installing them).
Configurations:
Enable pmcd, pmlogger, etc.
Set NVIDIA persistence mode.
Restart services.
Verification: Check metrics with pmprobe/pmval.
Custom Cockpit Extension: Implement the HTML's suggested JS/CSS for GPU dashboard (fetch or inline the code snippets).
End: Optional final reboot comment if needed; success message with access instructions (e.g., cockpit at http://localhost:9090).
Questions for further clarity to ensure best effort:

Any preferred error-handling style, like exiting on failure or continuing with warnings?
Should the script include cleanup (e.g., remove build artifacts) or keep it minimal?
For testing, how do we simulate/verification without a real GPU—perhaps add mock checks? This will help refine before coding.

Thought for 7s
15:00:00 27JUL25, Understood the clarifications—script assumes NVIDIA drivers are pre-installed and functional (verified via nvidia-smi check at start, but no install/update actions), focusing solely on Cockpit/PCP add-on without touching drivers; we'll proceed with single-GPU scope, modular add-on nature, and post-basic-setup expansion for the custom extension. Now addressing each point directly for alignment.

"Enable universe repo." This refers to enabling the 'universe' component in Ubuntu's software repositories, which provides access to community-maintained free and open-source software packages not included in the main repo. Example command: sudo add-apt-repository universe && sudo apt update – this adds the universe repo if not already enabled and refreshes the package list.

"Cockpit Installation: Use backported version from PPA or direct install as per HTML." This means installing a newer or backported (ported from a later Ubuntu release) version of Cockpit from a Personal Package Archive (PPA) rather than the default older version in Ubuntu 24.04's repos, to ensure compatibility with features like PCP integration. From the HTML, it specifies adding the PPA ppa.launchpadcontent.net/cockpit-project/cockpit/ubuntu, then installing cockpit and cockpit-pcp. Example commands: sudo add-apt-repository ppa:cockpit-project/cockpit && sudo apt update && sudo apt install -y cockpit cockpit-pcp.

"Configure with --with-nvidia=yes." Acknowledged—during the PCP source build, we'll use ./configure ... --with-nvidia=yes to enable NVIDIA support; for the other line defaulted to "no" (likely referring to something like ENABLE_NVIDIA_PMDA=no in a config file such as pmda/nvidia/pmda.conf or similar in the source tree), we can explicitly set it to "yes" post-configure by editing the file if needed, or confirm via grep after configure to ensure both are activated.

"Enable pmcd, pmlogger, etc." This means enabling and starting the Performance Co-Pilot (PCP) system services like pmcd (Performance Metrics Collector Daemon for metric collection), pmlogger (for logging metrics), pmie (for inference engine/rules), and possibly pmmgr (manager) via systemd, so they auto-start on boot and run immediately. Example: sudo systemctl enable --now pmcd pmlogger pmie – this enables them to start at boot and launches them now without a reboot.

On error-handling: For an installation script, the best approach is to continue with warnings on non-critical failures (e.g., if a package is already installed) to allow partial success and full logging, but exit on critical failures (e.g., build errors in PCP) to prevent proceeding with a broken setup—warnings can be colored using ANSI escapes like echo -e "\e[33mWarning: [message]\e[0m" for yellow text, making them visually distinct in terminal output.

Script will include cleanup, such as removing PCP build directories (e.g., rm -rf pcp-6.3.0 after install) and apt cache (sudo apt clean) to minimize disk usage and keep the system tidy.

No simulation needed since your test system has a GPU, and we'll design for general NVIDIA models by relying on standard PCP NVIDIA PMDA metrics that adapt to detected hardware.

To guarantee best effort before scripting, questions: 1) For the custom Cockpit extension, the HTML provides basic JS/CSS snippets for a GPU dashboard—should we inline them directly into files under /usr/share/cockpit/ or create a proper module/package for easier updates? 2) Any specific PCP metrics beyond the HTML's (e.g., gpu.utilization, gpu.memory.used) to prioritize in the initial extension, or start minimal? 3) Should the script include a final verification loop (e.g., retry pmval checks up to 3 times with sleep) to handle service startup delays?

"Enable universe repo." This refers to enabling the 'universe' component in Ubuntu's software repositories, which provides access to community-maintained free and open-source software packages not included in the main repo. Example command: sudo add-apt-repository universe && sudo apt update – this adds the universe repo if not already enabled and refreshes the package list."
We will need to do what is likely to provide success to this script.

Example: sudo systemctl enable --now pmcd pmlogger pmie – this enables them to start at boot and launches them now without a reboot."

Thought for 82s
15:10:00 27JUL25, Understood the refinements—focusing on success-oriented steps like enabling universe repo via the example command (sudo add-apt-repository universe && sudo apt update) if not already active, starting minimal with the HTML's basic extension snippets, and including a simple verification loop (e.g., up to 3 retries with 5s sleep) for pmval/pmprobe to account for common service init delays. For the custom Cockpit extension, to make updates easy, we'll create it as a proper module/package under /usr/share/cockpit/ (e.g., a dedicated directory like /usr/share/cockpit/gpu-monitor with manifest.json, index.html, and separate JS/CSS files), allowing modular edits or git-based pulls without overwriting core files—this supports versioning and separation from base Cockpit.

Based on the detailed HTML content fetched (which is essentially a bash script blueprint with build logs), here's an updated high-level plan for our dedicated Cockpit add-on script, adapted for Ubuntu 24.04 Server, single-run execution, no driver install/update (just verification via nvidia-smi at start, exit if missing), no reboots (comment any if present), idempotency (checks before installs), colored warnings (e.g., yellow for non-critical), exit on critical failures (e.g., build errors), cleanup (rm build dirs, apt clean), and minimal initial extension. The script will log to /var/log/cockpit-pcp-setup.log, start with version echo "Version 0.00.0 - $(date '+%H:%M:%S %d%b%y')", and assume root/sudo.

Planned script structure:

Header/Version/Logging: #!/bin/bash; set -euo pipefail; LOG_FILE=/var/log/cockpit-pcp-setup.log; exec > >(tee -a "$LOG_FILE") 2>&1; echo "Version 0.00.0 - $(date '+%H:%M:%S %d%b%y')"
Initial Checks: Verify NVIDIA ready (if ! nvidia-smi &> /dev/null; then echo -e "\e[31mError: NVIDIA drivers not detected. Install first and rerun.\e[0m"; exit 1; fi); Get DRIVER_VERSION=$(nvidia-smi --query-gpu=driver_version --format=csv,noheader | cut -d. -f1)
Enable Universe Repo: if ! grep -q universe /etc/apt/sources.list /etc/apt/sources.list.d/*.list; then sudo add-apt-repository universe -y && sudo apt update; fi
Install libnvidia-cfg1 if Needed: if ! dpkg -l | grep -q libnvidia-cfg1-"$DRIVER_VERSION"; then sudo apt install -y libnvidia-cfg1-"$DRIVER_VERSION"; fi
Update and Install Dependencies: sudo apt update -y; sudo apt install -y --no-install-recommends cockpit -t noble-backports cockpit-pcp pcp nvidia-cuda-toolkit bison flex g++ libavahi-common-dev libavahi-client-dev libavahi-glib-dev libmicrohttpd-dev libncurses-dev libreadline-dev libsasl2-dev python3 python3-dev python3-setuptools libpcp3-dev libpcp-pmda3-dev wget autoconf libtool libssl-dev libcairo2-dev libpango1.0-dev libglib2.0-dev (adding extras from build logs for compile success)
Build and Install PCP 6.3.0 with NVIDIA PMDA: wget https://github.com/performancecopilot/pcp/archive/refs/tags/6.3.0.tar.gz (note: HTML uses 6.3.7, but confirming via search if latest; for now, use 6.3.0 as stable); tar xzf 6.3.0.tar.gz; cd pcp-6.3.0; ./configure --prefix=/usr --sysconfdir=/etc --localstatedir=/var --with-nvidia=yes (enable explicitly, and check/edit any config file lines defaulted to no, e.g., grep -rl ENABLE_NVIDIA_PMDA . && sed -i 's/ENABLE_NVIDIA_PMDA=no/ENABLE_NVIDIA_PMDA=yes/' relevant_file if found); make -j$(nproc); sudo make install; cd src/pmdas/nvidia; echo "daemon" | sudo ./Install (as per HTML for daemon mode)
Enable and Start Services: sudo systemctl enable --now pmcd pmlogger pmie cockpit.socket (adding pmie as suggested earlier for completeness)
Set NVIDIA Persistence Mode: pkill -f nvidia-persistenced || true; nvidia-smi -pm 1; if ! pgrep nvidia-persistenced; then nvidia-persistenced --persistence-mode & fi
Restart Services: sudo systemctl restart pmcd pmlogger pmie
Verification with Loop: for i in {1..3}; do if pmprobe -v nvidia.gpu.utilization >/dev/null 2>&1; then echo "NVIDIA metrics available."; break; else echo -e "\e[33mWarning: Metrics not ready (attempt $i/3). Sleeping 5s...\e[0m"; sleep 5; fi; done; if [ $i -eq 3 ]; then echo -e "\e[31mError: Verification failed. Check logs.\e[0m"; exit 1; fi (adapt to key metrics like gpu.utilization, memory.used from HTML)
Setup Custom Cockpit Extension as Module: sudo mkdir -p /usr/share/cockpit/gpu-monitor; cd /usr/share/cockpit/gpu-monitor; echo '{ "version": 1, "name": "gpu-monitor", "description": "NVIDIA GPU Monitoring", "matches": ["gpu"], "path": "index.html" }' > manifest.json (expanded for proper module); echo 'GPU Monitor
GPU Metrics
' > index.html; echo 'body { font-family: sans-serif; } #gpu-chart { width: 100%; height: 400px; }' > style.css; echo 'document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", function() { /* Minimal JS to fetch metrics via cockpit.spawn(["pmval", "nvidia.gpu.utilization"]) and display - start with placeholder */ console.log("GPU Monitor Loaded"); });' > script.js (minimal, inline from HTML snippets, easy to update by editing files)
Cleanup: cd ../../..; rm -rf pcp-6.3.0* 6.3.0.tar.gz; sudo apt clean
End: echo "Setup complete. Access Cockpit at https://:9090 (enable HTTPS if needed). GPU monitor under Tools."
This plan incorporates the fetched HTML details precisely (e.g., PCP version 6.3.0/6.3.7 clarification needed, daemon install, basic HTML), with adaptations for our goals. Questions for best effort: 1) HTML shows PCP 6.3.7 but my plan uses 6.3.0—should we stick to 6.3.7 or check for latest stable? 2) For the extension JS, HTML's incomplete—add basic pmval calls via cockpit.spawn for utilization/temp, or keep as static placeholder? 3) Any additional deps from build logs (e.g., libssl-dev) to pre-install for configure/make success?

Thought for 19s
15:30:00 27JUL25, Understood the points—leveraging the tool results confirming PCP 6.3.7 as the latest stable release (dated March 2025, with no specific NVIDIA PMDA notes but aligning with the HTML's use), we'll base decisions on best practices for stability, compatibility with Ubuntu 24.04, and NVIDIA support; the current plan isn't a "hot mess" (it's a solid evolving outline from the HTML, with adaptations for our single-run, no-reboot goals), so no need to start over—instead, we'll refine it incrementally here, incrementing to version 0.00.1 in the planned script header once we code, to reflect updates like version correction, extension details, and deps.

"1) HTML shows PCP 6.3.7 but my plan uses 6.3.0—should we stick to 6.3.7 or check for latest stable?" Based on best practices (prioritizing the latest stable for bug fixes, security, and feature completeness, especially since the HTML explicitly uses 6.3.7 for NVIDIA PMDA), we'll update the plan to use 6.3.7—tool searches confirm it's the current stable (released March 2025), and we'll download from https://github.com/performancecopilot/pcp/archive/refs/tags/6.3.7.tar.gz to ensure NVIDIA support is enabled via --with-nvidia=yes.

"2) For the extension JS, HTML's incomplete—add basic pmval calls via cockpit.spawn for utilization/temp, or keep as static placeholder?" Cockpit.spawn is a JavaScript function in the Cockpit framework's API that allows your extension's JS code to securely execute external shell commands (like pmval for fetching PCP metrics) from the browser, capturing their output to dynamically update the UI—it's essential for real-time data display without full page reloads. Example: In script.js, you could add something like: cockpit.spawn(["pmval", "-s", "1", "-t", "1sec", "nvidia.gpu.utilization"]).stream(function(data) { document.getElementById('gpu-util').innerText = 'Utilization: ' + data.trim() + '%'; }).catch(function(err) { console.error('Error fetching utilization:', err); }); —this runs pmval once (with -s 1 for one sample, -t 1sec for interval), streams the output, and updates a DOM element; for temp, similarly: cockpit.spawn(["pmval", "-s", "1", "nvidia.gpu.temperature"]).stream(...); we'll add basic calls like this for utilization and temp to make it functional beyond static, starting minimal as you specified, while keeping it easy to expand.

"3) Any additional deps from build logs (e.g., libssl-dev) to pre-install for configure/make success?" To ensure success without unnecessary tools (no Grafana/Prometheus/Monitorix/Zabbix suggestions needed, as we're strictly enhancing Cockpit/PCP for lightweight GPU monitoring), we'll pre-install only the minimal deps inferred from HTML build logs and common PCP compile requirements: e.g., autoconf, libtool, bison, flex, g++, libavahi-common-dev, libavahi-client-dev, libavahi-glib-dev, libmicrohttpd-dev, libncurses-dev, libreadline-dev, libsasl2-dev, python3-dev, python3-setuptools, libpcp3-dev, libpcp-pmda3-dev, libssl-dev, libcairo2-dev, libpango1.0-dev, libglib2.0-dev—these prevent configure/make errors (like missing headers for Avahi, SSL, or Cairo during NVIDIA PMDA build), all available via apt without pulling in heavy alternatives.

Refined plan incorporating these (version bump to 0.00.1 in header, PCP to 6.3.7, basic cockpit.spawn in JS, expanded deps list):

Header/Version/Logging: #!/bin/bash; set -euo pipefail; LOG_FILE=/var/log/cockpit-pcp-setup.log; exec > >(tee -a "$LOG_FILE") 2>&1; echo "Version 0.00.1 - $(date '+%H:%M:%S %d%b%y')"
Initial Checks: if ! nvidia-smi &> /dev/null; then echo -e "\e[31mError: NVIDIA drivers not detected. Install first and rerun.\e[0m"; exit 1; fi; DRIVER_VERSION=$(nvidia-smi --query-gpu=driver_version --format=csv,noheader | cut -d. -f1)
Enable Universe Repo: if ! grep -q universe /etc/apt/sources.list /etc/apt/sources.list.d/*.list; then sudo add-apt-repository universe -y && sudo apt update; fi
Install libnvidia-cfg1 if Needed: if ! dpkg -l | grep -q libnvidia-cfg1-"$DRIVER_VERSION"; then sudo apt install -y libnvidia-cfg1-"$DRIVER_VERSION"; fi
Update and Install Dependencies: sudo apt update -y; sudo apt install -y --no-install-recommends cockpit -t noble-backports cockpit-pcp pcp nvidia-cuda-toolkit bison flex g++ libavahi-common-dev libavahi-client-dev libavahi-glib-dev libmicrohttpd-dev libncurses-dev libreadline-dev libsasl2-dev python3 python3-dev python3-setuptools libpcp3-dev libpcp-pmda3-dev wget autoconf libtool libssl-dev libcairo2-dev libpango1.0-dev libglib2.0-dev
Build and Install PCP 6.3.7 with NVIDIA PMDA: wget https://github.com/performancecopilot/pcp/archive/refs/tags/6.3.7.tar.gz; tar xzf 6.3.7.tar.gz; cd pcp-6.3.7; ./configure --prefix=/usr --sysconfdir=/etc --localstatedir=/var --with-nvidia=yes; (post-configure, check and edit if needed: grep -rl ENABLE_NVIDIA_PMDA . | xargs sed -i 's/ENABLE_NVIDIA_PMDA=no/ENABLE_NVIDIA_PMDA=yes/g'); make -j$(nproc); sudo make install; cd src/pmdas/nvidia; echo "daemon" | sudo ./Install
Enable and Start Services: sudo systemctl enable --now pmcd pmlogger pmie cockpit.socket
Set NVIDIA Persistence Mode: pkill -f nvidia-persistenced || true; nvidia-smi -pm 1; if ! pgrep nvidia-persistenced; then nvidia-persistenced --persistence-mode & fi
Restart Services: sudo systemctl restart pmcd pmlogger pmie
Verification with Loop: for i in {1..3}; do if pmprobe -v nvidia.gpu.utilization >/dev/null 2>&1 && pmprobe -v nvidia.gpu.temperature >/dev/null 2>&1; then echo "NVIDIA metrics available."; break; else echo -e "\e[33mWarning: Metrics not ready (attempt $i/3). Sleeping 5s...\e[0m"; sleep 5; fi; done; if [ $i -eq 3 ]; then echo -e "\e[31mError: Verification failed. Check logs.\e[0m"; exit 1; fi
Setup Custom Cockpit Extension as Module: sudo mkdir -p /usr/share/cockpit/gpu-monitor; cd /usr/share/cockpit/gpu-monitor; echo '{ "version": 1, "name": "gpu-monitor", "description": "NVIDIA GPU Monitoring", "matches": ["gpu"], "path": "index.html" }' > manifest.json; echo 'GPU Monitor
GPU Metrics
' > index.html; echo 'body { font-family: sans-serif; }' > style.css; echo 'document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", function() { cockpit.spawn(["pmval", "-s", "1", "nvidia.gpu.utilization"]).stream(function(data) { document.getElementById("gpu-util").innerText = "Utilization: " + data.trim() + "%"; }); cockpit.spawn(["pmval", "-s", "1", "nvidia.gpu.temperature"]).stream(function(data) { document.getElementById("gpu-temp").innerText = "Temperature: " + data.trim() + "°C"; }); });' > script.js
Cleanup: cd ../../..; rm -rf pcp-6.3.7* 6.3.7.tar.gz; sudo apt clean
End: echo "Setup complete. Access Cockpit at https://:9090/gpu. GPU monitor ready."
This refinement ensures stability and minimal functionality. For best effort clarity: 1) Should we add a check for Cockpit PPA (ppa:cockpit-project/cockpit) before installing cockpit, as implied in HTML? 2) For the extension, include a simple chart library (e.g., via CDN like Chart.js) for graphing metrics over time, or keep text-only for now? 3) Any specific log rotation or service hardening (e.g., firewall rules for port 9090) to include?

Thought for 25s
15:50:00 27JUL25, Understood—based on tool searches confirming PCP 6.3.7 as the latest stable release (tagged 6.3.7, dated March 28, 2025, with no specific NVIDIA PMDA notes in the release summary, but aligning with the HTML's usage for GPU support), we'll update the plan to stick with 6.3.7 for best practices in stability and feature completeness; the other links (organization overview and Ubuntu code search) didn't yield additional version or Ubuntu-specific insights (search required sign-in, showing no public code snippets for installation/configs), so no changes there, but we can rely on the HTML's Ubuntu 24.04 adaptations.

"2) For the extension JS, HTML's incomplete—add basic pmval calls via cockpit.spawn for utilization/temp, or keep as static placeholder?" As explained, cockpit.spawn lets the JS safely run commands like pmval from the browser to fetch real-time metrics and update the page dynamically (e.g., showing "Utilization: 45%" live instead of static text). I recommend adding basic calls for utilization and temperature (as in the example: cockpit.spawn(["pmval", "-s", "1", "nvidia.gpu.utilization"]).stream(...) to display in a 

), since a static placeholder would make the dashboard non-functional and useless for monitoring—starting minimal but operational ensures success, and it's easy to expand later.
"3) Any additional deps from build logs (e.g., libssl-dev) to pre-install for configure/make success?" I'll decide to include only the essential ones from HTML build logs and standard PCP requirements (e.g., libssl-dev for crypto during configure, libcairo2-dev/libpango1.0-dev/libglib2.0-dev for any graphical PMDA elements, and others like bison/flex for parsing)—this prevents compile failures without adding bloat or alternatives like Grafana.

Refined plan with these (version bump to 0.00.2 in header, PCP fixed at 6.3.7, functional JS with spawn, deps solidified; no major resets needed as the structure holds strong):

Header/Version/Logging: #!/bin/bash; set -euo pipefail; LOG_FILE=/var/log/cockpit-pcp-setup.log; exec > >(tee -a "$LOG_FILE") 2>&1; echo "Version 0.00.2 - $(date '+%H:%M:%S %d%b%y')" 2-4. Initial Checks, Enable Universe, libnvidia-cfg1: Unchanged.
Update and Install Dependencies: sudo apt update -y; sudo apt install -y --no-install-recommends cockpit -t noble-backports cockpit-pcp pcp nvidia-cuda-toolkit bison flex g++ libavahi-common-dev libavahi-client-dev libavahi-glib-dev libmicrohttpd-dev libncurses-dev libreadline-dev libsasl2-dev python3 python3-dev python3-setuptools libpcp3-dev libpcp-pmda3-dev wget autoconf libtool libssl-dev libcairo2-dev libpango1.0-dev libglib2.0-dev
Build and Install PCP 6.3.7 with NVIDIA PMDA: wget https://github.com/performancecopilot/pcp/archive/refs/tags/6.3.7.tar.gz; tar xzf 6.3.7.tar.gz; cd pcp-6.3.7; ./configure --prefix=/usr --sysconfdir=/etc --localstatedir=/var --with-nvidia=yes; grep -rl ENABLE_NVIDIA_PMDA . | xargs sed -i 's/ENABLE_NVIDIA_PMDA=no/ENABLE_NVIDIA_PMDA=yes/g'; make -j$(nproc); sudo make install; cd src/pmdas/nvidia; echo "daemon" | sudo ./Install 7-10. Services, Persistence, Restart, Verification: Unchanged, verifying utilization and temperature.
Setup Custom Cockpit Extension as Module: sudo mkdir -p /usr/share/cockpit/gpu-monitor; cd /usr/share/cockpit/gpu-monitor; echo '{ "version": 1, "name": "gpu-monitor", "description": "NVIDIA GPU Monitoring", "matches": ["gpu"], "path": "index.html" }' > manifest.json; echo 'GPU Monitor
GPU Metrics
' > index.html; echo 'body { font-family: sans-serif; }' > style.css; echo 'document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", function() { cockpit.spawn(["pmval", "-s", "1", "nvidia.gpu.utilization"]).stream(function(data) { document.getElementById("gpu-util").innerText = "Utilization: " + data.trim() + "%"; }).catch(function(err) { console.error("Utilization error:", err); }); cockpit.spawn(["pmval", "-s", "1", "nvidia.gpu.temperature"]).stream(function(data) { document.getElementById("gpu-temp").innerText = "Temperature: " + data.trim() + "°C"; }).catch(function(err) { console.error("Temperature error:", err); }); });' > script.js 12-13. Cleanup, End: Unchanged.
This sets us up for success with a working minimal dashboard. Questions for clarity: 1) The HTML mentions potential build errors if deps are missing—should we add a pre-check loop for configure (e.g., retry after apt install if fails)? 2) For the extension, add error handling in JS (as in the catch blocks) or keep simpler? 3) Include a note in the script to manually add the gpu-monitor to Cockpit's navigation if not auto-detected?

16:00:00 27JUL25, Understood the responses—integrating them for robustness: we'll add a simple pre-check for configure by running it once, capturing errors, and if it fails due to missing deps (grep for common error patterns like "missing header"), attempt an apt install of likely packages before retrying (up to 2 times), as this is a normal way to handle automated builds without manual intervention; for JS, a good developer would include basic error handling with catch blocks to log issues without crashing the page, keeping it user-friendly; and we'll add an echo note at the end: "If gpu-monitor doesn't appear in Cockpit navigation, manually add it via Cockpit's plugin settings or restart cockpit service." This maintains focus on success.

With tool confirmation that PCP 6.3.7 is indeed the latest stable (released March 28, 2025, no explicit NVIDIA/Ubuntu notes in release summary, but aligns with HTML's usage), we'll proceed with it; the other links (org page and code search) didn't yield new Ubuntu-specific insights beyond standard builds, so no changes there.

Refined plan with these updates (version bump to 0.00.3 in header, configure retry logic, JS catches, end note):

Header/Version/Logging: #!/bin/bash; set -euo pipefail; LOG_FILE=/var/log/cockpit-pcp-setup.log; exec > >(tee -a "$LOG_FILE") 2>&1; echo "Version 0.00.3 - $(date '+%H:%M:%S %d%b%y')" 2-4. Initial Checks, Enable Universe, libnvidia-cfg1: Unchanged.

Build and Install PCP 6.3.7 with NVIDIA PMDA: wget https://github.com/performancecopilot/pcp/archive/refs/tags/6.3.7.tar.gz; tar xzf 6.3.7.tar.gz; cd pcp-6.3.7; for attempt in {1..2}; do if ./configure --prefix=/usr --sysconfdir=/etc --localstatedir=/var --with-nvidia=yes 2>&1 | tee config.log; then break; else echo -e "\e[33mWarning: Configure failed (attempt $attempt/2). Checking for missing deps...\e[0m"; if grep -q "missing.*avahi" config.log; then sudo apt install -y libavahi-client-dev; fi; # Add similar greps for other common misses like ssl, cairo; fi; done; if [ $attempt -eq 2 ]; then echo -e "\e[31mError: Configure failed after retries. Check config.log.\e[0m"; exit 1; fi; grep -rl ENABLE_NVIDIA_PMDA . | xargs sed -i 's/ENABLE_NVIDIA_PMDA=no/ENABLE_NVIDIA_PMDA=yes/g'; make -j$(nproc); sudo make install; cd src/pmdas/nvidia; echo "daemon" | sudo ./Install 7-10. This ensures reliable builds and functional monitoring. 1) In the verification, add more metrics like memory.used if available, or keep to utilization/temp for minimal? 2) Should the script enable HTTPS for Cockpit (e.g., via certbot) or leave as HTTP with a warning? 3) Any preferred way to handle multi-user access in Cockpit (e.g., add users)?

- 3) Any preferred way to handle multi-user access in Cockpit (e.g., add users)?
No. There will just be one user. Nosana host only needs one user for groups and rootless docker and rootless podman. The permissions for that user is important and will be the username used in Cockpit.

Refined plan with these (version bump to 0.00.4 in header, added memory metric to pmprobe/pmval/JS with polling for live feel via setInterval every 5s in script.js, expanded configure greps for common deps, HTTP warning in end echo):

Header/Version/Logging: #!/bin/bash; set -euo pipefail; LOG_FILE=/var/log/cockpit-pcp-setup.log; exec > >(tee -a "$LOG_FILE") 2>&1; echo "Version 0.00.4 - $(date '+%H:%M:%S %d%b%y')" 2-4. Initial Checks, Enable Universe, libnvidia-cfg1: Unchanged.
Update and Install Dependencies: Unchanged.
Build and Install PCP 6.3.7 with NVIDIA PMDA: wget https://github.com/performancecopilot/pcp/archive/refs/tags/6.3.7.tar.gz; tar xzf 6.3.7.tar.gz; cd pcp-6.3.7; for attempt in {1..2}; do if ./configure --prefix=/usr --sysconfdir=/etc --localstatedir=/var --with-nvidia=yes 2>&1 | tee config.log; then break; else echo -e "\e[33mWarning: Configure failed (attempt $attempt/2). Checking for missing deps...\e[0m"; if grep -iq "avahi" config.log; then sudo apt install -y libavahi-client-dev libavahi-common-dev libavahi-glib-dev; fi; if grep -iq "ssl" config.log; then sudo apt install -y libssl-dev; fi; if grep -iq "cairo" config.log; then sudo apt install -y libcairo2-dev; fi; if grep -iq "pango" config.log; then sudo apt install -y libpango1.0-dev; fi; if grep -iq "glib" config.log; then sudo apt install -y libglib2.0-dev; fi; if grep -iq "microhttpd" config.log; then sudo apt install -y libmicrohttpd-dev; fi; sleep 2; fi; done; if [ $attempt -eq 2 ]; then echo -e "\e[31mError: Configure failed after retries. Check config.log.\e[0m"; exit 1; fi; grep -rl ENABLE_NVIDIA_PMDA . | xargs sed -i 's/ENABLE_NVIDIA_PMDA=no/ENABLE_NVIDIA_PMDA=yes/g'; make -j$(nproc); sudo make install; cd src/pmdas/nvidia; echo "daemon" | sudo ./Install 7-9. Services, Persistence, Restart: Unchanged.
Verification with Loop: for i in {1..3}; do if pmprobe -v nvidia.gpu.utilization >/dev/null 2>&1 && pmprobe -v nvidia.gpu.temperature >/dev/null 2>&1 && pmprobe -v nvidia.gpu.memory.used >/dev/null 2>&1; then echo "NVIDIA metrics available."; break; else echo -e "\e[33mWarning: Metrics not ready (attempt $i/3). Sleeping 5s...\e[0m"; sleep 5; fi; done; if [ $i -eq 3 ]; then echo -e "\e[31mError: Verification failed. Check logs.\e[0m"; exit 1; fi
Setup Custom Cockpit Extension as Module: sudo mkdir -p /usr/share/cockpit/gpu-monitor; cd /usr/share/cockpit/gpu-monitor; echo '{ "version": 1, "name": "gpu-monitor", "description": "NVIDIA GPU Monitoring", "matches": ["gpu"], "path": "index.html" }' > manifest.json; echo 'GPU Monitor
GPU Metrics
' > index.html; echo 'body { font-family: sans-serif; }' > style.css; echo 'function updateMetrics() { cockpit.spawn(["pmval", "-s", "1", "nvidia.gpu.utilization"]).stream(function(data) { document.getElementById("gpu-util").innerText = "Utilization: " + data.trim() + "%"; }).catch(function(err) { console.error("Utilization error:", err); document.getElementById("gpu-util").innerText = "Utilization: Error"; }); cockpit.spawn(["pmval", "-s", "1", "nvidia.gpu.temperature"]).stream(function(data) { document.getElementById("gpu-temp").innerText = "Temperature: " + data.trim() + "°C"; }).catch(function(err) { console.error("Temperature error:", err); document.getElementById("gpu-temp").innerText = "Temperature: Error"; }); cockpit.spawn(["pmval", "-s", "1", "nvidia.gpu.memory.used"]).stream(function(data) { document.getElementById("gpu-mem").innerText = "Memory Used: " + data.trim() + " MiB"; }).catch(function(err) { console.error("Memory error:", err); document.getElementById("gpu-mem").innerText = "Memory Used: Error"; }); } document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", function() { updateMetrics(); setInterval(updateMetrics, 5000); });' > script.js

If gpu-monitor doesn't appear in navigation, manually add via plugin settings or restart cockpit. Login with Nosana user credentials."

Thought for 176s
16:30:00 27JUL25, Understood—based on the attached image of Cockpit's built-in metrics page with live graphs (e.g., line charts for CPU usage, memory, disk I/O over time, styled in dark theme with PatternFly-like components), we'll enhance the custom GPU monitor extension to resemble that: using Chart.js via CDN for simple line charts showing metric history (e.g., last 60 samples at 5s intervals for utilization, temperature, memory used), without React to avoid build complexity, but with basic CSS for similarity; keep text-only as fallback but prioritize visual charts for customer value. No additional metrics like power.draw per your preference, and no Nosana user setup here. With clarity achieved and no further questions needed for best effort, we'll now code the single-run installation script (version bumped to 0.01.0 for chart integration), commenting out any reboot, assuming NVIDIA drivers pre-installed, and focusing on success for Ubuntu 24.04 Server single-GPU setups.

Here's the complete bash script, ready for testing—save as cockpit-pcp-gpu-setup.sh, chmod +x, run as root:

bash
#!/bin/bash
set -euo pipefail
LOG_FILE=/var/log/cockpit-pcp-setup.log
exec > >(tee -a "$LOG_FILE") 2>&1
echo "Version 0.01.0 - $(date '+%H:%M:%S %d%b%y')"

# Initial Checks
if ! nvidia-smi &> /dev/null; then
  echo -e "\e[31mError: NVIDIA drivers not detected. Install first and rerun.\e[0m"
  exit 1
fi
DRIVER_VERSION=$(nvidia-smi --query-gpu=driver_version --format=csv,noheader | cut -d. -f1)

# Enable Universe Repo
if ! grep -q universe /etc/apt/sources.list /etc/apt/sources.list.d/*.list; then
  sudo add-apt-repository universe -y && sudo apt update
fi

# Install libnvidia-cfg1 if Needed
if ! dpkg -l | grep -q libnvidia-cfg1-"$DRIVER_VERSION"; then
  sudo apt install -y libnvidia-cfg1-"$DRIVER_VERSION"
fi

# Update and Install Dependencies
sudo apt update -y
sudo apt install -y --no-install-recommends cockpit -t noble-backports cockpit-pcp pcp nvidia-cuda-toolkit bison flex g++ libavahi-common-dev libavahi-client-dev libavahi-glib-dev libmicrohttpd-dev libncurses-dev libreadline-dev libsasl2-dev python3 python3-dev python3-setuptools libpcp3-dev libpcp-pmda3-dev wget autoconf libtool libssl-dev libcairo2-dev libpango1.0-dev libglib2.0-dev

# Add Cockpit PPA if not present (for backported version)
if ! grep -q "cockpit-project" /etc/apt/sources.list.d/*.list; then
  sudo add-apt-repository ppa:cockpit-project/cockpit -y
  sudo apt update -y
fi

# Build and Install PCP 6.3.7 with NVIDIA PMDA
wget https://github.com/performancecopilot/pcp/archive/refs/tags/6.3.7.tar.gz
tar xzf 6.3.7.tar.gz
cd pcp-6.3.7
for attempt in {1..2}; do
  if ./configure --prefix=/usr --sysconfdir=/etc --localstatedir=/var --with-nvidia=yes 2>&1 | tee config.log; then
    break
  else
    echo -e "\e[33mWarning: Configure failed (attempt $attempt/2). Checking for missing deps...\e[0m"
    if grep -iq "avahi" config.log; then sudo apt install -y libavahi-client-dev libavahi-common-dev libavahi-glib-dev; fi
    if grep -iq "ssl" config.log; then sudo apt install -y libssl-dev; fi
    if grep -iq "cairo" config.log; then sudo apt install -y libcairo2-dev; fi
    if grep -iq "pango" config.log; then sudo apt install -y libpango1.0-dev; fi
    if grep -iq "glib" config.log; then sudo apt install -y libglib2.0-dev; fi
    if grep -iq "microhttpd" config.log; then sudo apt install -y libmicrohttpd-dev; fi
    sleep 2
  fi
done
if [ $attempt -eq 2 ]; then
  echo -e "\e[31mError: Configure failed after retries. Check config.log.\e[0m"
  exit 1
fi
grep -rl ENABLE_NVIDIA_PMDA . | xargs sed -i 's/ENABLE_NVIDIA_PMDA=no/ENABLE_NVIDIA_PMDA=yes/g' || true
make -j$(nproc)
sudo make install
cd src/pmdas/nvidia
echo "daemon" | sudo ./Install

# Enable and Start Services
sudo systemctl enable --now pmcd pmlogger pmie cockpit.socket

# Set NVIDIA Persistence Mode
pkill -f nvidia-persistenced || true
nvidia-smi -pm 1
if ! pgrep nvidia-persistenced; then
  nvidia-persistenced --persistence-mode &
fi

# Restart Services
sudo systemctl restart pmcd pmlogger pmie

# Verification with Loop
for i in {1..3}; do
  if pmprobe -v nvidia.gpu.utilization >/dev/null 2>&1 && pmprobe -v nvidia.gpu.temperature >/dev/null 2>&1 && pmprobe -v nvidia.gpu.memory.used >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    echo "NVIDIA metrics available."
    break
  else
    echo -e "\e[33mWarning: Metrics not ready (attempt $i/3). Sleeping 5s...\e[0m"
    sleep 5
  fi
done
if [ $i -eq 3 ]; then
  echo -e "\e[31mError: Verification failed. Check logs.\e[0m"
  exit 1
fi

# Setup Custom Cockpit Extension as Module with Charts
sudo mkdir -p /usr/share/cockpit/gpu-monitor
cd /usr/share/cockpit/gpu-monitor
echo '{
  "version": 1,
  "name": "gpu-monitor",
  "description": "NVIDIA GPU Monitoring",
  "matches": ["gpu"],
  "path": "index.html"
}' > manifest.json
echo '


  GPU Monitor
  
  
  


  
GPU Metrics

  

    

      

        
Utilization

        

      

    

    

      

        
Temperature

        

      

    

    

      

        
Memory Used

        

      

    

  


' > index.html
echo 'const utilData = { labels: [], datasets: [{ label: "Utilization (%)", data: [], borderColor: "green" }] };
const tempData = { labels: [], datasets: [{ label: "Temperature (°C)", data: [], borderColor: "blue" }] };
const memData = { labels: [], datasets: [{ label: "Memory Used (MiB)", data: [], borderColor: "orange" }] };
const chartOptions = { scales: { x: { type: "time", time: { unit: "second" } } }, animation: false };

let utilChart, tempChart, memChart;

function updateCharts(metric, value) {
  const now = new Date().toLocaleTimeString();
  switch(metric) {
    case "util":
      utilData.labels.push(now);
      utilData.datasets[0].data.push(value);
      if (utilData.labels.length > 60) { utilData.labels.shift(); utilData.datasets[0].data.shift(); }
      utilChart.update();
      break;
    case "temp":
      tempData.labels.push(now);
      tempData.datasets[0].data.push(value);
      if (tempData.labels.length > 60) { tempData.labels.shift(); tempData.datasets[0].data.shift(); }
      tempChart.update();
      break;
    case "mem":
      memData.labels.push(now);
      memData.datasets[0].data.push(value);
      if (memData.labels.length > 60) { memData.labels.shift(); memData.datasets[0].data.shift(); }
      memChart.update();
      break;
  }
}

function fetchMetric(cmd, metric) {
  cockpit.spawn(cmd).stream(function(data) {
    const value = parseFloat(data.trim());
    if (!isNaN(value)) updateCharts(metric, value);
  }).catch(function(err) { console.error(`${metric} error:`, err); });
}

document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", function() {
  utilChart = new Chart(document.getElementById("utilChart"), { type: "line", data: utilData, options: chartOptions });
  tempChart = new Chart(document.getElementById("tempChart"), { type: "line", data: tempData, options: chartOptions });
  memChart = new Chart(document.getElementById("memChart"), { type: "line", data: memData, options: chartOptions });

  setInterval(() => {
    fetchMetric(["pmval", "-s", "1", "nvidia.gpu.utilization"], "util");
    fetchMetric(["pmval", "-s", "1", "nvidia.gpu.temperature"], "temp");
    fetchMetric(["pmval", "-s", "1", "nvidia.gpu.memory.used"], "mem");
  }, 5000);
});' > script.js

# Cleanup
cd ../../..
rm -rf pcp-6.3.7* 6.3.7.tar.gz
sudo apt clean

# End
echo "Setup complete. Access Cockpit at http://:9090/gpu (HTTP only; enable HTTPS manually for production security). GPU monitor with live charts ready. If not appearing in navigation, restart cockpit or check plugin settings. Login with system credentials."
# reboot  # Commented for testing; uncomment for production if needed after full install.
12 web pages

[sudo] password for md: 
./cp.sh: 1: Syntax error: "(" unexpected

  libjs-sprintf-js libjs-typedarray-to-buffer libuv1-dev node-abbrev

  node-async-each node-babel-plugin-add-module-exports node-babel7-runtime

  node-commander node-commondir node-concat-stream
  node-console-control-strings node-convert-source-map node-core-js
  node-core-js-pure node-core-util-is node-data-uri-to-buffer
  node-decompress-response node-deep-is node-defaults node-define-property
  node-delegates node-depd node-diff node-electron-to-chromium node-encoding
  node-end-of-stream node-err-code node-error-ex node-es-module-lexer

 cockpit-bridge : Conflicts: cockpit-pcp

Thought for 80s
Version 0.01.1 - 16:55:00 27JUL25
#!/bin/bash
set -euo pipefail
LOG_FILE=/var/log/cockpit-pcp-setup.log
exec > >(tee -a "$LOG_FILE") 2>&1
echo "Version 0.01.1 - $(date '+%H:%M:%S %d%b%y')"

Initial Checks
if ! nvidia-smi &> /dev/null; then
echo -e "\e[31mError: NVIDIA drivers not detected. Install first and rerun.\e[0m"
exit 1
fi
DRIVER_VERSION=$(nvidia-smi --query-gpu=driver_version --format=csv,noheader | cut -d. -f1)

Purge existing Cockpit and PCP to avoid conflicts
sudo apt purge -y cockpit* pcp* || true

Enable Universe Repo
if ! grep -q universe /etc/apt/sources.list /etc/apt/sources.list.d/*.list; then
sudo add-apt-repository universe -y
fi

Enable Backports if not already (for Cockpit)
if ! grep -q noble-backports /etc/apt/sources.list /etc/apt/sources.list.d/*.list; then
sudo add-apt-repository "deb http://us.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu noble-backports main restricted universe multiverse" -y
fi
sudo apt update -y

Install libnvidia-cfg1 if Needed
if ! dpkg -l | grep -q libnvidia-cfg1-"$DRIVER_VERSION"; then
sudo apt install -y libnvidia-cfg1-"$DRIVER_VERSION"
fi

Update and Install Dependencies (use backports for Cockpit and cockpit-pcp)
sudo apt install -y --no-install-recommends -t noble-backports cockpit cockpit-pcp
sudo apt install -y --no-install-recommends nvidia-cuda-toolkit bison flex g++ libavahi-common-dev libavahi-client-dev libavahi-glib-dev libmicrohttpd-dev libncurses-dev libreadline-dev libsasl2-dev python3 python3-dev python3-setuptools libpcp3-dev libpcp-pmda3-dev wget autoconf libtool libssl-dev libcairo2-dev libpango1.0-dev libglib2.0-dev

Build and Install PCP 6.3.7 with NVIDIA PMDA
wget https://github.com/performancecopilot/pcp/archive/refs/tags/6.3.7.tar.gz
tar xzf 6.3.7.tar.gz
cd pcp-6.3.7
for attempt in {1..2}; do
if ./configure --prefix=/usr --sysconfdir=/etc --localstatedir=/var --with-nvidia=yes 2>&1 | tee config.log; then
break
else
echo -e "\e[33mWarning: Configure failed (attempt $attempt/2). Checking for missing deps...\e[0m"
if grep -iq "avahi" config.log; then sudo apt install -y libavahi-client-dev libavahi-common-dev libavahi-glib-dev; fi
if grep -iq "ssl" config.log; then sudo apt install -y libssl-dev; fi
if grep -iq "cairo" config.log; then sudo apt install -y libcairo2-dev; fi
if grep -iq "pango" config.log; then sudo apt install -y libpango1.0-dev; fi
if grep -iq "glib" config.log; then sudo apt install -y libglib2.0-dev; fi
if grep -iq "microhttpd" config.log; then sudo apt install -y libmicrohttpd-dev; fi
sleep 2
fi
done
if [ $attempt -eq 2 ]; then
echo -e "\e[31mError: Configure failed after retries. Check config.log.\e[0m"
exit 1
fi
grep -rl ENABLE_NVIDIA_PMDA . | xargs sed -i 's/ENABLE_NVIDIA_PMDA=no/ENABLE_NVIDIA_PMDA=yes/g' || true
make -j$(nproc)
sudo make install
cd src/pmdas/nvidia
echo "daemon" | sudo ./Install

Enable and Start Services
sudo systemctl enable --now pmcd pmlogger pmie cockpit.socket

Set NVIDIA Persistence Mode
pkill -f nvidia-persistenced || true
nvidia-smi -pm 1
if ! pgrep nvidia-persistenced; then
nvidia-persistenced --persistence-mode &
fi

Restart Services
sudo systemctl restart pmcd pmlogger pmie

Verification with Loop
for i in {1..3}; do
if pmprobe -v nvidia.gpu.utilization >/dev/null 2>&1 && pmprobe -v nvidia.gpu.temperature >/dev/null 2>&1 && pmprobe -v nvidia.gpu.memory.used >/dev/null 2>&1; then
echo "NVIDIA metrics available."
break
else
echo -e "\e[33mWarning: Metrics not ready (attempt $i/3). Sleeping 5s...\e[0m"
sleep 5
fi
done
if [ $i -eq 3 ]; then
echo -e "\e[31mError: Verification failed. Check logs.\e[0m"
exit 1
fi

Setup Custom Cockpit Extension as Module with Charts
sudo mkdir -p /usr/share/cockpit/gpu-monitor
cd /usr/share/cockpit/gpu-monitor
echo '{
"version": 1,
"name": "gpu-monitor",
"description": "NVIDIA GPU Monitoring",
"matches": ["gpu"],
"path": "index.html"
}' > manifest.json
echo '

GPU Monitor   
GPU Metrics
Utilization

Temperature

Memory Used

' > index.html echo 'const utilData = { labels: [], datasets: [{ label: "Utilization (%)", data: [], borderColor: "green" }] }; const tempData = { labels: [], datasets: [{ label: "Temperature (°C)", data: [], borderColor: "blue" }] }; const memData = { labels: [], datasets: [{ label: "Memory Used (MiB)", data: [], borderColor: "orange" }] }; const chartOptions = { scales: { x: { type: "time", time: { unit: "second" } } }, animation: false };
let utilChart, tempChart, memChart;

function updateCharts(metric, value) {
const now = new Date().toLocaleTimeString();
switch(metric) {
case "util":
utilData.labels.push(now);
utilData.datasets[0].data.push(value);
if (utilData.labels.length > 60) { utilData.labels.shift(); utilData.datasets[0].data.shift(); }
utilChart.update();
break;
case "temp":
tempData.labels.push(now);
tempData.datasets[0].data.push(value);
if (tempData.labels.length > 60) { tempData.labels.shift(); tempData.datasets[0].data.shift(); }
tempChart.update();
break;
case "mem":
memData.labels.push(now);
memData.datasets[0].data.push(value);
if (memData.labels.length > 60) { memData.labels.shift(); memData.datasets[0].data.shift(); }
memChart.update();
break;
}
}

function fetchMetric(cmd, metric) {
cockpit.spawn(cmd).stream(function(data) {
const value = parseFloat(data.trim());
if (!isNaN(value)) updateCharts(metric, value);
}).catch(function(err) { console.error(${metric} error:, err); });
}

document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", function() {
utilChart = new Chart(document.getElementById("utilChart"), { type: "line", data: utilData, options: chartOptions });
tempChart = new Chart(document.getElementById("tempChart"), { type: "line", data: tempData, options: chartOptions });
memChart = new Chart(document.getElementById("memChart"), { type: "line", data: memData, options: chartOptions });

setInterval(() => {
fetchMetric(["pmval", "-s", "1", "nvidia.gpu.utilization"], "util");
fetchMetric(["pmval", "-s", "1", "nvidia.gpu.temperature"], "temp");
fetchMetric(["pmval", "-s", "1", "nvidia.gpu.memory.used"], "mem");
}, 5000);
});' > script.js

Cleanup
cd ../../..
rm -rf pcp-6.3.7* 6.3.7.tar.gz
sudo apt clean
sudo apt autoremove -y

End
echo "Setup complete. Access Cockpit at http://:9090/gpu (HTTP only; enable HTTPS manually for production security). GPU monitor with live charts ready. If not appearing in navigation, restart cockpit or check plugin settings. Login with system credentials."

reboot # Commented for testing; uncomment for production if needed after full install.
19 web pages
"echo "Setup complete. Access Cockpit at http://:9090/gpu (HTTP only; enable HTTPS manually for production security). GPU monitor with live charts ready. If not appearing in navigation, restart cockpit or check plugin settings. Login with system credentials."

reboot # Commented for testing; uncomment for production if needed after full install."

Reading state information...

requested an impossible situation or if you are using the unstable
distribution that some required packages have not yet been created
or been moved out of Incoming.
The following information may help to resolve the situation:

The following packages have unmet dependencies:
 cockpit-bridge : Conflicts: cockpit-pcp
E: Unable to correct problems, you have held broken packages.
md@nn06:~$ 
Thought for 52s
16:05:00 27Jul25, No, you don't need to manually reboot during testing since the reboot is commented out in the script for that purpose—only uncomment it in production if a full system restart is required after everything is set up (e.g., for kernel changes, but here it's not necessary). However, if the GPU monitor plugin doesn't appear in Cockpit's navigation after running the script, manually restart the Cockpit service with sudo systemctl restart cockpit to reload plugins without rebooting. Your workflow (> cp.sh && nano cp.sh && chmod +x cp.sh && sudo ./cp.sh) is fine for iterative testing, but the execution errors suggest issues like missing shebang (ensure #!/bin/bash is the very first line, no spaces before), line ending problems (run dos2unix cp.sh if copied from Windows/macOS), or incompatible shell (Ubuntu 24.04's bash supports -o pipefail, but confirm with bash --version).

The main installation error stems from a version conflict: Newer Cockpit versions (326+) integrate PCP directly into cockpit-bridge, making the separate cockpit-pcp package obsolete and causing conflicts when trying to install it. Since we're building a custom PCP 6.3.7 from source for NVIDIA PMDA support, we can skip installing cockpit-pcp via apt and let Cockpit use the system PCP. I've updated the script to version 0.01.2 accordingly: purge any conflicting packages, add the Cockpit PPA for a compatible version, install only cockpit (not cockpit-pcp), build PCP from source, and restart Cockpit at the end for immediate plugin visibility. This should resolve the unmet dependencies. Also suppressed some apt warnings and added a check to remove duplicate sources entries if present.

Here's the revised script—copy it carefully, ensure line endings are Unix (LF), and run your workflow:

bash
#!/bin/bash
set -euo pipefail
LOG_FILE=/var/log/cockpit-pcp-setup.log
exec > >(tee -a "$LOG_FILE") 2>&1
echo "Version 0.01.2 - $(date '+%H:%M:%S %d%b%y')"

# Purge existing Cockpit and PCP to avoid conflicts (apt packages only; source-built handled by overwrite)
sudo apt purge -y cockpit* pcp* libpcp* || true
sudo apt autoremove -y || true

# Clean duplicate sources if present (suppress warnings)
sudo sed -i '/deb http:\/\/us.archive.ubuntu.com\/ubuntu noble-backports/d' /etc/apt/sources.list /etc/apt/sources.list.d/* || true
sudo apt update -qq > /dev/null 2>&1

# Initial Checks
if ! nvidia-smi &> /dev/null; then
  echo -e "\e[31mError: NVIDIA drivers not detected. Install first and rerun.\e[0m"
  exit 1
fi
DRIVER_VERSION=$(nvidia-smi --query-gpu=driver_version --format=csv,noheader | cut -d. -f1)

# Enable Universe Repo
if ! grep -q universe /etc/apt/sources.list /etc/apt/sources.list.d/*.list; then
  sudo add-apt-repository universe -y > /dev/null 2>&1
fi

# Add Cockpit PPA for backported compatible version
if ! grep -q "cockpit-project" /etc/apt/sources.list.d/*.list; then
  sudo add-apt-repository ppa:cockpit-project/cockpit -y > /dev/null 2>&1
fi
sudo apt update -qq > /dev/null 2>&1

# Install libnvidia-cfg1 if Needed
if ! dpkg -l | grep -q libnvidia-cfg1-"$DRIVER_VERSION"; then
  sudo apt install -y libnvidia-cfg1-"$DRIVER_VERSION" > /dev/null 2>&1
fi

# Install Cockpit (without cockpit-pcp, as it's obsolete in newer versions) and Dependencies
sudo apt install -y --no-install-recommends cockpit nvidia-cuda-toolkit bison flex g++ libavahi-common-dev libavahi-client-dev libavahi-glib-dev libmicrohttpd-dev libncurses-dev libreadline-dev libsasl2-dev python3 python3-dev python3-setuptools libpcp3-dev libpcp-pmda3-dev wget autoconf libtool libssl-dev libcairo2-dev libpango1.0-dev libglib2.0-dev > /dev/null 2>&1

# Build and Install PCP 6.3.7 with NVIDIA PMDA (overwrites any existing)
wget https://github.com/performancecopilot/pcp/archive/refs/tags/6.3.7.tar.gz -q
tar xzf 6.3.7.tar.gz
cd pcp-6.3.7
for attempt in {1..2}; do
  if ./configure --prefix=/usr --sysconfdir=/etc --localstatedir=/var --with-nvidia=yes 2>&1 | tee config.log; then
    break
  else
    echo -e "\e[33mWarning: Configure failed (attempt $attempt/2). Checking for missing deps...\e[0m"
    if grep -iq "avahi" config.log; then sudo apt install -y libavahi-client-dev libavahi-common-dev libavahi-glib-dev > /dev/null 2>&1; fi
    if grep -iq "ssl" config.log; then sudo apt install -y libssl-dev > /dev/null 2>&1; fi
    if grep -iq "cairo" config.log; then sudo apt install -y libcairo2-dev > /dev/null 2>&1; fi
    if grep -iq "pango" config.log; then sudo apt install -y libpango1.0-dev > /dev/null 2>&1; fi
    if grep -iq "glib" config.log; then sudo apt install -y libglib2.0-dev > /dev/null 2>&1; fi
    if grep -iq "microhttpd" config.log; then sudo apt install -y libmicrohttpd-dev > /dev/null 2>&1; fi
    sleep 2
  fi
done
if [ $attempt -eq 2 ]; then
  echo -e "\e[31mError: Configure failed after retries. Check config.log.\e[0m"
  exit 1
fi
grep -rl ENABLE_NVIDIA_PMDA . | xargs sed -i 's/ENABLE_NVIDIA_PMDA=no/ENABLE_NVIDIA_PMDA=yes/g' || true
make -j$(nproc)
sudo make install
cd src/pmdas/nvidia
echo "daemon" | sudo ./Install

# Enable and Start Services
sudo systemctl enable --now pmcd pmlogger pmie cockpit.socket

# Set NVIDIA Persistence Mode
pkill -f nvidia-persistenced || true
nvidia-smi -pm 1
if ! pgrep nvidia-persistenced; then
  nvidia-persistenced --persistence-mode &
fi

# Restart Services
sudo systemctl restart pmcd pmlogger pmie

# Verification with Loop
for i in {1..3}; do
  if pmprobe -v nvidia.gpu.utilization >/dev/null 2>&1 && pmprobe -v nvidia.gpu.temperature >/dev/null 2>&1 && pmprobe -v nvidia.gpu.memory.used >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    echo "NVIDIA metrics available."
    break
  else
    echo -e "\e[33mWarning: Metrics not ready (attempt $i/3). Sleeping 5s...\e[0m"
    sleep 5
  fi
done
if [ $i -eq 3 ]; then
  echo -e "\e[31mError: Verification failed. Check logs.\e[0m"
  exit 1
fi

# Setup Custom Cockpit Extension as Module with Charts
sudo mkdir -p /usr/share/cockpit/gpu-monitor
cd /usr/share/cockpit/gpu-monitor
echo '{
  "version": 1,
  "name": "gpu-monitor",
  "description": "NVIDIA GPU Monitoring",
  "matches": ["gpu"],
  "path": "index.html"
}' > manifest.json
echo '


  GPU Monitor
  
  
  


  
GPU Metrics

  

    

      

        
Utilization

        

      

    

    

      

        
Temperature

        

      

    

    

      

        
Memory Used

        

      

    

  


' > index.html
echo 'const utilData = { labels: [], datasets: [{ label: "Utilization (%)", data: [], borderColor: "green" }] };
const tempData = { labels: [], datasets: [{ label: "Temperature (°C)", data: [], borderColor: "blue" }] };
const memData = { labels: [], datasets: [{ label: "Memory Used (MiB)", data: [], borderColor: "orange" }] };
const chartOptions = { scales: { x: { type: "time", time: { unit: "second" } } }, animation: false };

let utilChart, tempChart, memChart;

function updateCharts(metric, value) {
  const now = new Date().toLocaleTimeString();
  switch(metric) {
    case "util":
      utilData.labels.push(now);
      utilData.datasets[0].data.push(value);
      if (utilData.labels.length > 60) { utilData.labels.shift(); utilData.datasets[0].data.shift(); }
      utilChart.update();
      break;
    case "temp":
      tempData.labels.push(now);
      tempData.datasets[0].data.push(value);
      if (tempData.labels.length > 60) { tempData.labels.shift(); tempData.datasets[0].data.shift(); }
      tempChart.update();
      break;
    case "mem":
      memData.labels.push(now);
      memData.datasets[0].data.push(value);
      if (memData.labels.length > 60) { memData.labels.shift(); memData.datasets[0].data.shift(); }
      memChart.update();
      break;
  }
}

function fetchMetric(cmd, metric) {
  cockpit.spawn(cmd).stream(function(data) {
    const value = parseFloat(data.trim());
    if (!isNaN(value)) updateCharts(metric, value);
  }).catch(function(err) { console.error(`${metric} error:`, err); });
}

document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", function() {
  utilChart = new Chart(document.getElementById("utilChart"), { type: "line", data: utilData, options: chartOptions });
  tempChart = new Chart(document.getElementById("tempChart"), { type: "line", data: tempData, options: chartOptions });
  memChart = new Chart(document.getElementById("memChart"), { type: "line", data: memData, options: chartOptions });

  setInterval(() => {
    fetchMetric(["pmval", "-s", "1", "nvidia.gpu.utilization"], "util");
    fetchMetric(["pmval", "-s", "1", "nvidia.gpu.temperature"], "temp");
    fetchMetric(["pmval", "-s", "1", "nvidia.gpu.memory.used"], "mem");
  }, 5000);
});' > script.js

# Cleanup
cd ../../..
rm -rf pcp-6.3.7* 6.3.7.tar.gz
sudo apt clean > /dev/null 2>&1
sudo apt autoremove -y > /dev/null 2>&1

# Restart Cockpit to load the new plugin
sudo systemctl restart cockpit

# End
echo "Setup complete. Access Cockpit at http://:9090/gpu (HTTP only; enable HTTPS manually for production security). GPU monitor with live charts ready. If not appearing in navigation, check plugin settings. Login with system credentials."
# reboot  # Commented for testing; uncomment for production if needed after full install.
10 web pages

md@nn06:~$ 

i don't think the script completed.
Thought for 20s
bash
#!/bin/bash
set -euo pipefail
LOG_FILE=/var/log/cockpit-pcp-setup.log
exec > >(tee -a "$LOG_FILE") 2>&1
echo "Version 0.01.3 - $(date '+%H:%M:%S %d%b%y')"

# Temporarily disable exit on error for purge/autoremove
set +e
sudo apt purge -y -q --allow-change-held-packages cockpit* pcp* libpcp* || true
sudo apt autoremove -y -q || true
set -e

# Clean duplicate sources if present
sudo sed -i '/deb http:\/\/us.archive.ubuntu.com\/ubuntu noble-backports/d' /etc/apt/sources.list /etc/apt/sources.list.d/* 2>/dev/null || true
sudo apt update -qq > /dev/null 2>&1

# Initial Checks
if ! nvidia-smi &> /dev/null; then
  echo -e "\e[31mError: NVIDIA drivers not detected. Install first and rerun.\e[0m"
  exit 1
fi
DRIVER_VERSION=$(nvidia-smi --query-gpu=driver_version --format=csv,noheader | cut -d. -f1)

# Enable Universe Repo
if ! grep -q universe /etc/apt/sources.list /etc/apt/sources.list.d/*.list; then
  sudo add-apt-repository universe -y > /dev/null 2>&1
fi

# Add Cockpit PPA for backported compatible version
if ! grep -q "cockpit-project" /etc/apt/sources.list.d/*.list; then
  sudo add-apt-repository ppa:cockpit-project/cockpit -y > /dev/null 2>&1
fi
sudo apt update -qq > /dev/null 2>&1

# Install libnvidia-cfg1 if Needed
if ! dpkg -l | grep -q libnvidia-cfg1-"$DRIVER_VERSION"; then
  sudo apt install -y libnvidia-cfg1-"$DRIVER_VERSION" > /dev/null 2>&1
fi

# Install Cockpit (without cockpit-pcp) and Dependencies
sudo apt install -y --no-install-recommends cockpit nvidia-cuda-toolkit bison flex g++ libavahi-common-dev libavahi-client-dev libavahi-glib-dev libmicrohttpd-dev libncurses-dev libreadline-dev libsasl2-dev python3 python3-dev python3-setuptools libpcp3-dev libpcp-pmda3-dev wget autoconf libtool libssl-dev libcairo2-dev libpango1.0-dev libglib2.0-dev > /dev/null 2>&1

# Build and Install PCP 6.3.7 with NVIDIA PMDA (check if dir exists for idempotency)
if [ ! -d "pcp-6.3.7" ]; then
  wget https://github.com/performancecopilot/pcp/archive/refs/tags/6.3.7.tar.gz -q
  tar xzf 6.3.7.tar.gz
fi
cd pcp-6.3.7
for attempt in {1..2}; do
  if ./configure --prefix=/usr --sysconfdir=/etc --localstatedir=/var --with-nvidia=yes 2>&1 | tee config.log; then
    break
  else
    echo -e "\e[33mWarning: Configure failed (attempt $attempt/2). Checking for missing deps...\e[0m"
    if grep -iq "avahi" config.log; then sudo apt install -y libavahi-client-dev libavahi-common-dev libavahi-glib-dev > /dev/null 2>&1; fi
    if grep -iq "ssl" config.log; then sudo apt install -y libssl-dev > /dev/null 2>&1; fi
    if grep -iq "cairo" config.log; then sudo apt install -y libcairo2-dev > /dev/null 2>&1; fi
    if grep -iq "pango" config.log; then sudo apt install -y libpango1.0-dev > /dev/null 2>&1; fi
    if grep -iq "glib" config.log; then sudo apt install -y libglib2.0-dev > /dev/null 2>&1; fi
    if grep -iq "microhttpd" config.log; then sudo apt install -y libmicrohttpd-dev > /dev/null 2>&1; fi
    sleep 2
  fi
done
if [ $attempt -eq 2 ]; then
  echo -e "\e[31mError: Configure failed after retries. Check config.log.\e[0m"
  exit 1
fi
grep -rl ENABLE_NVIDIA_PMDA . | xargs sed -i 's/ENABLE_NVIDIA_PMDA=no/ENABLE_NVIDIA_PMDA=yes/g' || true
make -j$(nproc)
sudo make install
cd src/pmdas/nvidia
echo "daemon" | sudo ./Install

# Enable and Start Services
sudo systemctl enable --now pmcd pmlogger pmie cockpit.socket

# Set NVIDIA Persistence Mode
pkill -f nvidia-persistenced || true
nvidia-smi -pm 1
if ! pgrep nvidia-persistenced; then
  nvidia-persistenced --persistence-mode &
fi

# Restart Services
sudo systemctl restart pmcd pmlogger pmie

# Verification with Loop
for i in {1..3}; do
  if pmprobe -v nvidia.gpu.utilization >/dev/null 2>&1 && pmprobe -v nvidia.gpu.temperature >/dev/null 2>&1 && pmprobe -v nvidia.gpu.memory.used >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    echo "NVIDIA metrics available."
    break
  else
    echo -e "\e[33mWarning: Metrics not ready (attempt $i/3). Sleeping 5s...\e[0m"
    sleep 5
  fi
done
if [ $i -eq 3 ]; then
  echo -e "\e[31mError: Verification failed. Check logs.\e[0m"
  exit 1
fi

# Setup Custom Cockpit Extension as Module with Charts
sudo mkdir -p /usr/share/cockpit/gpu-monitor
cd /usr/share/cockpit/gpu-monitor
echo '{
  "version": 1,
  "name": "gpu-monitor",
  "description": "NVIDIA GPU Monitoring",
  "matches": ["gpu"],
  "path": "index.html"
}' > manifest.json
echo '


  GPU Monitor
  
  
  


  
GPU Metrics

  

    

      

        
Utilization

        

      

    

    

      

        
Temperature

        

      

    

    

      

        
Memory Used

        

      

    

  


' > index.html
echo 'const utilData = { labels: [], datasets: [{ label: "Utilization (%)", data: [], borderColor: "green" }] };
const tempData = { labels: [], datasets: [{ label: "Temperature (°C)", data: [], borderColor: "blue" }] };
const memData = { labels: [], datasets: [{ label: "Memory Used (MiB)", data: [], borderColor: "orange" }] };
const chartOptions = { scales: { x: { type: "time", time: { unit: "second" } } }, animation: false };

let utilChart, tempChart, memChart;

function updateCharts(metric, value) {
  const now = new Date().toLocaleTimeString();
  switch(metric) {
    case "util":
      utilData.labels.push(now);
      utilData.datasets[0].data.push(value);
      if (utilData.labels.length > 60) { utilData.labels.shift(); utilData.datasets[0].data.shift(); }
      utilChart.update();
      break;
    case "temp":
      tempData.labels.push(now);
      tempData.datasets[0].data.push(value);
      if (tempData.labels.length > 60) { tempData.labels.shift(); tempData.datasets[0].data.shift(); }
      tempChart.update();
      break;
    case "mem":
      memData.labels.push(now);
      memData.datasets[0].data.push(value);
      if (memData.labels.length > 60) { memData.labels.shift(); memData.datasets[0].data.shift(); }
      memChart.update();
      break;
  }
}

function fetchMetric(cmd, metric) {
  cockpit.spawn(cmd).stream(function(data) {
    const value = parseFloat(data.trim());
    if (!isNaN(value)) updateCharts(metric, value);
  }).catch(function(err) { console.error(`${metric} error:`, err); });
}

document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", function() {
  utilChart = new Chart(document.getElementById("utilChart"), { type: "line", data: utilData, options: chartOptions });
  tempChart = new Chart(document.getElementById("tempChart"), { type: "line", data: tempData, options: chartOptions });
  memChart = new Chart(document.getElementById("memChart"), { type: "line", data: memData, options: chartOptions });

  setInterval(() => {
    fetchMetric(["pmval", "-s", "1", "nvidia.gpu.utilization"], "util");
    fetchMetric(["pmval", "-s", "1", "nvidia.gpu.temperature"], "temp");
    fetchMetric(["pmval", "-s", "1", "nvidia.gpu.memory.used"], "mem");
  }, 5000);
});' > script.js

# Cleanup
cd ../../..
rm -rf pcp-6.3.7* 6.3.7.tar.gz
sudo apt clean > /dev/null 2>&1
sudo apt autoremove -y > /dev/null 2>&1

# Restart Cockpit to load the new plugin
sudo systemctl restart cockpit

# End
echo "Setup complete. Access Cockpit at http://:9090/gpu (HTTP only; enable HTTPS manually for production security). GPU monitor with live charts ready. If not appearing in navigation, check plugin settings. Login with system credentials."
# reboot  # Commented for testing; uncomment for production if needed after full install.

bash
#!/bin/bash
set -euo pipefail
LOG_FILE=/var/log/cockpit-pcp-setup.log
exec > >(tee -a "$LOG_FILE") 2>&1
echo "Version 0.01.4 - $(date '+%H:%M:%S %d%b%y')"

# Temporarily disable exit on error for purge/autoremove
set +e
sudo apt purge -y -q --allow-change-held-packages cockpit* pcp* libpcp* || true
sudo apt autoremove -y -q || true
set -e

# Clean duplicate sources if present
sudo sed -i '/deb http:\/\/us.archive.ubuntu.com\/ubuntu noble-backports/d' /etc/apt/sources.list /etc/apt/sources.list.d/* 2>/dev/null || true
sudo apt update -qq > /dev/null 2>&1

# Initial Checks
if ! nvidia-smi &> /dev/null; then
  echo -e "\e[31mError: NVIDIA drivers not detected. Install first and rerun.\e[0m"
  exit 1
fi
DRIVER_VERSION=$(nvidia-smi --query-gpu=driver_version --format=csv,noheader | cut -d. -f1)

# Enable Universe Repo
if ! grep -q universe /etc/apt/sources.list /etc/apt/sources.list.d/*.list; then
  sudo add-apt-repository universe -y > /dev/null 2>&1
fi

# Add Cockpit PPA for backported compatible version
if ! grep -q "cockpit-project" /etc/apt/sources.list.d/*.list; then
  sudo add-apt-repository ppa:cockpit-project/cockpit -y > /dev/null 2>&1
fi
sudo apt update -qq > /dev/null 2>&1

# Install libnvidia-cfg1 if Needed
if ! dpkg -l | grep -q libnvidia-cfg1-"$DRIVER_VERSION"; then
  sudo apt install -y libnvidia-cfg1-"$DRIVER_VERSION" > /dev/null 2>&1
fi

# Install Cockpit (without cockpit-pcp) and Dependencies
sudo apt install -y --no-install-recommends cockpit nvidia-cuda-toolkit bison flex g++ libavahi-common-dev libavahi-client-dev libavahi-glib-dev libmicrohttpd-dev libncurses-dev libreadline-dev libsasl2-dev python3 python3-dev python3-setuptools libpcp3-dev libpcp-pmda3-dev wget autoconf libtool libssl-dev libcairo2-dev libpango1.0-dev libglib2.0-dev > /dev/null 2>&1

# Build and Install PCP 6.3.7 with NVIDIA PMDA (check if tar.gz and dir exist for idempotency)
if [ ! -f "6.3.7.tar.gz" ]; then
  wget https://github.com/performancecopilot/pcp/archive/refs/tags/6.3.7.tar.gz -q -O 6.3.7.tar.gz
fi
if [ ! -d "pcp-6.3.7" ]; then
  tar xzf 6.3.7.tar.gz
fi
cd pcp-6.3.7
for attempt in {1..2}; do
  if ./configure --prefix=/usr --sysconfdir=/etc --localstatedir=/var --with-nvidia=yes 2>&1 | tee config.log; then
    break
  else
    echo -e "\e[33mWarning: Configure failed (attempt $attempt/2). Checking for missing deps...\e[0m"
    if grep -iq "avahi" config.log; then sudo apt install -y libavahi-client-dev libavahi-common-dev libavahi-glib-dev > /dev/null 2>&1; fi
    if grep -iq "ssl" config.log; then sudo apt install -y libssl-dev > /dev/null 2>&1; fi
    if grep -iq "cairo" config.log; then sudo apt install -y libcairo2-dev > /dev/null 2>&1; fi
    if grep -iq "pango" config.log; then sudo apt install -y libpango1.0-dev > /dev/null 2>&1; fi
    if grep -iq "glib" config.log; then sudo apt install -y libglib2.0-dev > /dev/null 2>&1; fi
    if grep -iq "microhttpd" config.log; then sudo apt install -y libmicrohttpd-dev > /dev/null 2>&1; fi
    sleep 2
  fi
done
if [ $attempt -eq 2 ]; then
  echo -e "\e[31mError: Configure failed after retries. Check config.log.\e[0m"
  exit 1
fi
grep -rl ENABLE_NVIDIA_PMDA . | xargs sed -i 's/ENABLE_NVIDIA_PMDA=no/ENABLE_NVIDIA_PMDA=yes/g' || true
make -j$(nproc)
sudo make install
cd src/pmdas/nvidia
echo "daemon" | sudo ./Install

# Enable and Start Services
sudo systemctl enable --now pmcd pmlogger pmie cockpit.socket

# Set NVIDIA Persistence Mode
pkill -f nvidia-persistenced || true
nvidia-smi -pm 1
if ! pgrep nvidia-persistenced; then
  nvidia-persistenced --persistence-mode &
fi

# Restart Services
sudo systemctl restart pmcd pmlogger pmie

# Verification with Loop
for i in {1..3}; do
  if pmprobe -v nvidia.gpu.utilization >/dev/null 2>&1 && pmprobe -v nvidia.gpu.temperature >/dev/null 2>&1 && pmprobe -v nvidia.gpu.memory.used >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    echo "NVIDIA metrics available."
    break
  else
    echo -e "\e[33mWarning: Metrics not ready (attempt $i/3). Sleeping 5s...\e[0m"
    sleep 5
  fi
done
if [ $i -eq 3 ]; then
  echo -e "\e[31mError: Verification failed. Check logs.\e[0m"
  exit 1
fi

# Setup Custom Cockpit Extension as Module with Charts
sudo mkdir -p /usr/share/cockpit/gpu-monitor
cd /usr/share/cockpit/gpu-monitor
echo '{
  "version": 1,
  "name": "gpu-monitor",
  "description": "NVIDIA GPU Monitoring",
  "matches": ["gpu"],
  "path": "index.html"
}' > manifest.json
echo '


  GPU Monitor
  
  
  


  
GPU Metrics

  

    

      

        
Utilization

        

      

    

    

      

        
Temperature

        

      

    

    

      

        
Memory Used

        

      

    

  


' > index.html
echo 'const utilData = { labels: [], datasets: [{ label: "Utilization (%)", data: [], borderColor: "green" }] };
const tempData = { labels: [], datasets: [{ label: "Temperature (°C)", data: [], borderColor: "blue" }] };
const memData = { labels: [], datasets: [{ label: "Memory Used (MiB)", data: [], borderColor: "orange" }] };
const chartOptions = { scales: { x: { type: "time", time: { unit: "second" } } }, animation: false };

let utilChart, tempChart, memChart;

function updateCharts(metric, value) {
  const now = new Date().toLocaleTimeString();
  switch(metric) {
    case "util":
      utilData.labels.push(now);
      utilData.datasets[0].data.push(value);
      if (utilData.labels.length > 60) { utilData.labels.shift(); utilData.datasets[0].data.shift(); }
      utilChart.update();
      break;
    case "temp":
      tempData.labels.push(now);
      tempData.datasets[0].data.push(value);
      if (tempData.labels.length > 60) { tempData.labels.shift(); tempData.datasets[0].data.shift(); }
      tempChart.update();
      break;
    case "mem":
      memData.labels.push(now);
      memData.datasets[0].data.push(value);
      if (memData.labels.length > 60) { memData.labels.shift(); memData.datasets[0].data.shift(); }
      memChart.update();
      break;
  }
}

function fetchMetric(cmd, metric) {
  cockpit.spawn(cmd).stream(function(data) {
    const value = parseFloat(data.trim());
    if (!isNaN(value)) updateCharts(metric, value);
  }).catch(function(err) { console.error(`${metric} error:`, err); });
}

document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", function() {
  utilChart = new Chart(document.getElementById("utilChart"), { type: "line", data: utilData, options: chartOptions });
  tempChart = new Chart(document.getElementById("tempChart"), { type: "line", data: tempData, options: chartOptions });
  memChart = new Chart(document.getElementById("memChart"), { type: "line", data: memData, options: chartOptions });

  setInterval(() => {
    fetchMetric(["pmval", "-s", "1", "nvidia.gpu.utilization"], "util");
    fetchMetric(["pmval", "-s", "1", "nvidia.gpu.temperature"], "temp");
    fetchMetric(["pmval", "-s", "1", "nvidia.gpu.memory.used"], "mem");
  }, 5000);
});' > script.js

# Cleanup
cd ../../..
rm -rf pcp-6.3.7* 6.3.7.tar.gz
sudo apt clean > /dev/null 2>&1
sudo apt autoremove -y > /dev/null 2>&1

# Restart Cockpit to load the new plugin
sudo systemctl restart cockpit

# End
echo "Setup complete. Access Cockpit at http://:9090/gpu (HTTP only; enable HTTPS manually for production security). GPU monitor with live charts ready. If not appearing in navigation, check plugin settings. Login with system credentials."
# reboot  # Commented for testing; uncomment for production if needed after full install.
