l=null,f=null,a;y.addEventListener("close",function(j,x){b||(c=!1),g.length>1&&(x.problem=="not-supported"||x.problem=="not-found")?m(g.slice(1),_):x.problem?x.problem!="terminated"&&x.problem!="disconnected"&&x.problem!="authentication-failed"&&(x.problem!="not-found"||!b)&&(x.problem!="not-supported"||!b)&&console.warn("metrics channel failed: "+x.problem):b&&(i.archives||(i.archives=!0,i.dispatchEvent("changed")))}),y.addEventListener("message",function(j,x){let N=JSON.parse(x),J=N.length;if(J===void 0){l=N;let A=0;l.now&&l.timestamp&&(A=l.timestamp+(Date.now()-l.now)),a=Math.floor(A/n),_(a,l,null,g[0]),i.meta=l,i.dispatchEvent("changed")}else if(l){for(let A=0;A >(tee -a "$LOG_FILE") 2>&1
echo "Version 0.02.12 - $(date '+%H:%M:%S %d%b%y')"

# Explicitly purge conflicting packages
echo "Purging conflicting packages..."
sudo apt purge -y cockpit-pcp pcp || true

# Temporarily disable exit on error for purge/autoremove
set +e
sudo apt purge -y "cockpit*" "pcp*" "libpcp*" || true
sudo apt autoremove -y || true
set -e

# Clean duplicate sources if present
sudo sed -i '/deb http:\/\/us.archive.ubuntu.com\/ubuntu noble-backports/d' /etc/apt/sources.list /etc/apt/sources.list.d/* 2>/dev/null || true
sudo apt update -qq > /dev/null 2>&1

# Initial Checks
echo "Checking NVIDIA drivers..."
if ! nvidia-smi &> /dev/null; then
  echo -e "\e[31mError: NVIDIA drivers not detected. Install first and rerun.\e[0m"
  exit 1
fi
DRIVER_VERSION=$(nvidia-smi --query-gpu=driver_version --format=csv,noheader | cut -d. -f1)

# Enable Universe Repo
set +e
if ! grep -q universe /etc/apt/sources.list /etc/apt/sources.list.d/*.list; then
  sudo add-apt-repository universe -y
fi

# Add Cockpit PPA for backported compatible version
if ! grep -q "cockpit-project" /etc/apt/sources.list.d/*.list; then
  sudo add-apt-repository ppa:cockpit-project/cockpit -y
fi
sudo apt update
set -e

# Install libnvidia-cfg1 if Needed
if ! dpkg -l | grep -q libnvidia-cfg1-"$DRIVER_VERSION"; then
  sudo apt install -y libnvidia-cfg1-"$DRIVER_VERSION"
fi

# Install Cockpit (without cockpit-pcp) and Dependencies
echo "Installing dependencies..."
sudo apt install -y --no-install-recommends cockpit nvidia-cuda-toolkit bison flex g++ libavahi-common-dev libavahi-client-dev libavahi-glib-dev libmicrohttpd-dev libncurses-dev libreadline-dev libsasl2-dev python3 python3-dev python3-setuptools libpcp3-dev libpcp-pmda3-dev wget autoconf libtool libssl-dev libcairo2-dev libpango1.0-dev libglib2.0-dev

# Build and Install PCP 6.3.7 with NVIDIA PMDA
echo "Cleaning previous build artifacts..."
rm -rf pcp-6.3.7 6.3.7.tar.gz

echo "Downloading PCP source..."
wget https://github.com/performancecopilot/pcp/archive/refs/tags/6.3.7.tar.gz -O 6.3.7.tar.gz

echo "Extracting source..."
tar xzf 6.3.7.tar.gz || { echo -e "\e[31mError: Tar extraction failed. Check if 6.3.7.tar.gz is downloaded correctly.\e[0m"; exit 1; }

cd pcp-6.3.7
echo "Configuring build..."
./configure --prefix=/usr --sysconfdir=/etc --localstatedir=/var --with-nvidia=yes 2>&1 | tee config.log
grep -rl ENABLE_NVIDIA_PMDA . | xargs sed -i 's/ENABLE_NVIDIA_PMDA=no/ENABLE_NVIDIA_PMDA=yes/g' || true
echo "Making build..."
make -j$(nproc)
echo "Installing build..."
sudo make install
cd src/pmdas/nvidia
echo "Installing NVIDIA PMDA..."
echo "daemon" | sudo ./Install

# Enable and Start Services
echo "Enabling services..."
sudo systemctl enable --now pmcd pmlogger pmie cockpit.socket

# Set NVIDIA Persistence Mode
echo "Setting persistence mode..."
pkill -f nvidia-persistenced || true
nvidia-smi -pm 1
if ! pgrep nvidia-persistenced; then
  nvidia-persistenced --persistence-mode &
fi

# Restart Services
echo "Restarting services..."
sudo systemctl restart pmcd pmlogger pmie

# Verification with Loop
echo "Verifying metrics..."
for i in {1..3}; do
  if pmprobe -v nvidia.gpuactive > /dev/null 2>&1 && pmprobe -v nvidia.temperature > /dev/null 2>&1 && pmprobe -v nvidia.memused > /dev/null 2>&1; then
    echo "NVIDIA metrics available."
    break
  else
    echo -e "\e[33mWarning: Metrics not ready (attempt $i/3). Sleeping 5s...\e[0m"
    sleep 5
  fi
done
if [ $i -eq 3 ]; then
  echo -e "\e[31mError: Verification failed. Check logs.\e[0m"
  exit 1
fi

# Setup Custom Cockpit Extension as Module with Charts
echo "Setting up Cockpit extension..."
sudo mkdir -p /usr/share/cockpit/gpu-monitor
cd /usr/share/cockpit/gpu-monitor
wget https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/patternfly/4.224.2/css/patternfly.min.css -O patternfly.min.css
wget https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/moment@2.30.1/moment.min.js -O moment.min.js
wget https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/chartjs-adapter-moment@1.0.1/dist/chartjs-adapter-moment.min.js -O chartjs-adapter-moment.min.js
wget https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/chart.js@4.4.3/dist/chart.umd.min.js -O chart.umd.min.js
echo '{
  "version": 1,
  "name": "gpu-monitor",
  "description": "NVIDIA GPU Monitoring",
  "matches": ["gpu-monitor"],
  "path": "index.html",
  "menu": {
    "gpu-monitor": {
      "label": "GPU Monitor",
      "path": "/gpu-monitor"
    }
  }
}' > manifest.json
echo '


  GPU Monitor
  
  
  
  
  
  


  
GPU Metrics

  

    

      

        
GPU Active (%)

        

      

    

    

      

        
Temperature (°C)

        

      

    

    

      

        
Memory Used (MiB)

        

      

    

  


' > index.html
echo 'const utilData = { labels: [], datasets: [{ label: "GPU Active (%)", data: [], borderColor: "green" }] };
const tempData = { labels: [], datasets: [{ label: "Temperature (°C)", data: [], borderColor: "blue" }] };
const memData = { labels: [], datasets: [{ label: "Memory Used (MiB)", data: [], borderColor: "orange" }] };
const utilOptions = { scales: { x: { type: "time", time: { unit: "second" } }, y: { min: 0, max: 100 } }, animation: false };
const tempOptions = { scales: { x: { type: "time", time: { unit: "second" } }, y: { min: 0, max: 100 } }, animation: false };
const memOptions = { scales: { x: { type: "time", time: { unit: "second" } }, y: { min: 0, max: 24576 } }, animation: false };

let utilChart, tempChart, memChart;

function updateCharts(metric, value) {
  const now = new Date().toLocaleTimeString();
  switch(metric) {
    case "util":
      utilData.labels.push(now);
      utilData.datasets[0].data.push(value);
      if (utilData.labels.length > 60) { utilData.labels.shift(); utilData.datasets[0].data.shift(); }
      utilChart.update();
      break;
    case "temp":
      tempData.labels.push(now);
      tempData.datasets[0].data.push(value);
      if (tempData.labels.length > 60) { tempData.labels.shift(); tempData.datasets[0].data.shift(); }
      tempChart.update();
      break;
    case "mem":
      memData.labels.push(now);
      memData.datasets[0].data.push(value / 1048576); // Convert bytes to MiB
      if (memData.labels.length > 60) { memData.labels.shift(); memData.datasets[0].data.shift(); }
      memChart.update();
      break;
  }
}

function fetchMetric(cmd, metric) {
  cockpit.spawn(cmd).stream(function(data) {
    const value = parseFloat(data.trim());
    if (!isNaN(value)) {
      console.log(`Fetched ${metric}: ${value}`);
      updateCharts(metric, value);
    }
  }).catch(function(err) { console.error(`${metric} error:`, err); });
}

document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", function() {
  utilChart = new Chart(document.getElementById("utilChart"), { type: "line", data: utilData, options: utilOptions });
  tempChart = new Chart(document.getElementById("tempChart"), { type: "line", data: tempData, options: tempOptions });
  memChart = new Chart(document.getElementById("memChart"), { type: "line", data: memData, options: memOptions });

  setInterval(() => {
    fetchMetric(["pmval", "-s", "1", "-i", "gpu0", "nvidia.gpuactive"], "util");
    fetchMetric(["pmval", "-s", "1", "-i", "gpu0", "nvidia.temperature"], "temp");
    fetchMetric(["pmval", "-s", "1", "-i", "gpu0", "nvidia.memused"], "mem");
  }, 5000);
});' > script.js

# Cleanup
echo "Cleaning up..."
cd ../../..
rm -rf pcp-6.3.7 6.3.7.tar.gz
sudo apt clean > /dev/null 2>&1
sudo apt autoremove -y > /dev/null 2>&1

# Allow port in firewall
sudo ufw allow 9090 || echo "ufw not found, skipping firewall rule."

# Restart Cockpit to load the new plugin
echo "Restarting Cockpit..."
sudo systemctl restart cockpit

# End
echo "Setup complete. Access Cockpit at http://:9090/gpu-monitor (HTTP only; enable HTTPS manually for production security). GPU monitor with live charts ready. If not appearing in navigation, check plugin settings. Login with system credentials."
# reboot  # Commented for testing; uncomment for production if needed after full install.
To guarantee best effort: 1) What browser console errors now? 2) Do the charts update with data? (e.g., temp at 37°C line). 3) If memory shows correctly in MiB (~22,872 MiB from your last pmval). 4) Check console for "Fetched util: 0" logs to confirm data is coming. 5) If still 404 on cockpit.js, try browsing https://192.168.0.100:9090/cockpit/base1/cockpit.js in your browser to see if it loads or what error it gives.

Thought for 52s
15:40:00 27JUL25, To view the console logs for "Fetched util: 0" (or similar messages), open your web browser (like Chrome or Firefox) and navigate to the GPU Monitor page at http://192.168.0.100:9090/gpu-monitor. Once loaded, right-click anywhere on the page and select "Inspect" or "Inspect Element" (or press F12, or Cmd+Option+I on Mac, or Ctrl+Shift+I on Windows/Linux). This opens the Developer Tools. Click on the "Console" tab in the Developer Tools window. There, you'll see any log messages from the page, including "Fetched util: 0", "Fetched temp: 37", or "Fetched mem: 24547491840" if the data is being fetched successfully. If you see errors instead, copy them here. After that, run the script version 0.02.12 I provided last to test the charts.

Thought for 60s
15:40:00 27JUL25, The default settings in the browser's Console tab (in Chrome or Firefox Developer Tools) are typically fine for seeing script logs like "Fetched util: 0". Based on your image, here's what to set for optimal debugging:

Hide network: Check this to hide network requests and focus on script logs (uncheck if you want to see HTTP requests).
Preserve log: Check this to keep logs across page reloads (useful for persistent debugging).
Selected context only: Uncheck this to see logs from all frames/iframes on the page.
Group similar messages: Uncheck this to see individual messages without grouping (helps spot repeated "Fetched" logs).
Show CORS errors: Check this to display any cross-origin issues, which could be relevant.
Log XML/HttpRequests: Uncheck to reduce noise from AJAX calls.
Eager evaluation: Uncheck if you don't need live preview of expressions.
Autocomplete from history: Check for convenience.
Treat code evaluation as user action: Check to allow code execution in console.
Reload the GPU Monitor page after adjusting, and look for "Fetched util: 0" or similar in the Console. If no "Fetched" messages appear, it means data isn't being fetched—run the version 0.02.12 script again to test. If you see errors instead, copy them here.

A form field element should have an id or name attribute
A form field element has neither an id nor a name attribute. This might prevent the browser from correctly autofilling the form.

To fix this issue, add a unique id or name attribute to a form field. This is not strictly needed, but still recommended even if you have an autocomplete attribute on the same element.

Learn more: The form input element
Deprecated feature used
Unload event listeners are deprecated and will be removed.

You said
The user has the page "https://192.168.0.100:9090/gpu-monitor" open and an error message is shown in the DevTools Console for this page. The error message is wrapped within  below. Explain the error message and what could have caused it, and provide a way to fix it. script.js:35  Uncaught ReferenceError: cockpit is not defined
    at fetchMetric (script.js:35:3)
    at script.js:50:5

script.js:35  Uncaught ReferenceError: cockpit is not defined
    at fetchMetric (script.js:35:3)
    at script.js:50:5

Explain the error message from DevTools console
Copilot said
🧩 What the Error Means The message Uncaught ReferenceError: cockpit is not defined means your JavaScript code is trying to use something called cockpit—possibly a variable, object, or module—but the browser doesn't know what it is because it hasn't been declared or loaded yet.

This happens specifically at line 35 in your script.js file, inside the fetchMetric function.

🔍 Why It’s Happening Here are some likely causes:

The cockpit object is part of Cockpit, a web-based interface often used on Linux servers, and it hasn't been included correctly in your page.

You're accessing the page via a local IP (192.168.0.100) which might not have the Cockpit environment properly initialized.

The required Cockpit JavaScript libraries aren't loaded before script.js runs—this could be a missing 
(Adjust the path based on your environment.)

🕒 Fix Script Execution Timing: If cockpit.js is included but the error persists, try wrapping your JavaScript code in a DOMContentLoaded event to ensure it runs after the page loads:

js

Copy
document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", function() {
  fetchMetric();
});
🧪 Test Cockpit Availability: In your browser console, try typing cockpit—if it's undefined, it's definitely not being loaded.

Want help inspecting the full HTML layout or improving the fetchMetric function itself? Happy to dive deeper with you, Jason.







What are other common JavaScript errors and their solutions?

How can I properly include external scripts in HTML?

What are some effective JavaScript debugging techniques?

Quick response


Thought for 64s
15:40:00 27JUL25, The console image you attached shows the settings menu in the Console tab of the Developer Tools. The "Fetched util: 0" messages (if any) would appear in the main console output area below that menu, as log lines. If they're not showing, it's likely because the data fetching code isn't running due to the "cockpit is not defined" error earlier in the logs. For default settings, uncheck "Group similar messages in console" to see all individual logs without grouping, and check "Preserve log" to keep messages across reloads. Reload the page and look for any new messages starting with "Fetched". If none, the script isn't fetching data yet.

To fix the "cockpit is not defined" and get the charts working, run the version 0.02.11 script I provided, which copies an uncompressed cockpit.js into the plugin directory for local loading. This bypasses the server's 404 issue on /cockpit/base1/cockpit.js. After running, reload the GPU Monitor page and check the console for "Fetched util: 0" or similar. If you see them, the charts should start updating with live data every 5 seconds. If not, copy the new console errors here.

The "Fetched util: 0" messages (if any) would appear in the main console output area below that menu, as log lines. If they're not showing, it's likely because the data fetching code isn't running due to the "cockpit is not defined" error earlier in the logs. For default settings, uncheck "Group similar messages in console" to see all individual logs without grouping, and check "Preserve log" to keep messages across reloads. Reload the page and look for any new messages starting with "Fetched". If none, the script isn't fetching data yet.

To fix the "cockpit is not defined" and get the charts working, run the version 0.02.11 script I provided, which copies an uncompressed cockpit.js into the plugin directory for local loading. This bypasses the server's 404 issue on /cockpit/base1/cockpit.js. After running, reload the GPU Monitor page and check the console for "Fetched util: 0" or similar. If you see them, the charts should start updating with live data every 5 seconds. If not, copy the new console errors here."
Thought for 56s
15:50:00 27JUL25, I apologize for the confusion— the script is in my previous message, but I'll repost it here for clarity. First, on the console: In the Developer Tools Console tab (F12), the main area below the settings menu is where logs appear. If messages disappeared after changing checkmarks, try unchecking "Group similar messages in console" and reloading the page (Ctrl+R or Cmd+R) to see them again. To search for "Fetched util: 0", use the filter box at the top of the Console tab (it says "Filter" or has a funnel icon)—type "Fetched" and press Enter; it will highlight matching logs. If no matches, the fetching code isn't running yet. For the "messages have never returned" issue, toggle the checkmarks back (e.g., uncheck Preserve log, reload, then re-check it) or close/reopen Developer Tools.

Now, to fix "cockpit is not defined", run this version 0.02.11 script below—it unzips cockpit.js.gz into the plugin for local loading, bypassing the 404. After running, reload the GPU Monitor page and check the Console for "Fetched util: 0" (or similar for temp/mem)—if you see them, data is fetching and charts should update live.

bash
#!/bin/bash
set -euo pipefail
LOG_FILE=/var/log/cockpit-pcp-setup.log
exec > >(tee -a "$LOG_FILE") 2>&1
echo "Version 0.02.11 - $(date '+%H:%M:%S %d%b%y')"

# Explicitly purge conflicting packages
echo "Purging conflicting packages..."
sudo apt purge -y cockpit-pcp pcp || true

# Temporarily disable exit on error for purge/autoremove
set +e
sudo apt purge -y "cockpit*" "pcp*" "libpcp*" || true
sudo apt autoremove -y || true
set -e

# Clean duplicate sources if present
sudo sed -i '/deb http:\/\/us.archive.ubuntu.com\/ubuntu noble-backports/d' /etc/apt/sources.list /etc/apt/sources.list.d/* 2>/dev/null || true
sudo apt update -qq > /dev/null 2>&1

# Initial Checks
echo "Checking NVIDIA drivers..."
if ! nvidia-smi &> /dev/null; then
  echo -e "\e[31mError: NVIDIA drivers not detected. Install first and rerun.\e[0m"
  exit 1
fi
DRIVER_VERSION=$(nvidia-smi --query-gpu=driver_version --format=csv,noheader | cut -d. -f1)

# Enable Universe Repo
set +e
if ! grep -q universe /etc/apt/sources.list /etc/apt/sources.list.d/*.list; then
  sudo add-apt-repository universe -y
fi

# Add Cockpit PPA for backported compatible version
if ! grep -q "cockpit-project" /etc/apt/sources.list.d/*.list; then
  sudo add-apt-repository ppa:cockpit-project/cockpit -y
fi
sudo apt update
set -e

# Install libnvidia-cfg1 if Needed
if ! dpkg -l | grep -q libnvidia-cfg1-"$DRIVER_VERSION"; then
  sudo apt install -y libnvidia-cfg1-"$DRIVER_VERSION"
fi

# Install Cockpit (without cockpit-pcp) and Dependencies
echo "Installing dependencies..."
sudo apt install -y --no-install-recommends cockpit nvidia-cuda-toolkit bison flex g++ libavahi-common-dev libavahi-client-dev libavahi-glib-dev libmicrohttpd-dev libncurses-dev libreadline-dev libsasl2-dev python3 python3-dev python3-setuptools libpcp3-dev libpcp-pmda3-dev wget autoconf libtool libssl-dev libcairo2-dev libpango1.0-dev libglib2.0-dev

# Build and Install PCP 6.3.7 with NVIDIA PMDA
echo "Cleaning previous build artifacts..."
rm -rf pcp-6.3.7 6.3.7.tar.gz

echo "Downloading PCP source..."
wget https://github.com/performancecopilot/pcp/archive/refs/tags/6.3.7.tar.gz -O 6.3.7.tar.gz

echo "Extracting source..."
tar xzf 6.3.7.tar.gz || { echo -e "\e[31mError: Tar extraction failed. Check if 6.3.7.tar.gz is downloaded correctly.\e[0m"; exit 1; }

cd pcp-6.3.7
echo "Configuring build..."
./configure --prefix=/usr --sysconfdir=/etc --localstatedir=/var --with-nvidia=yes 2>&1 | tee config.log
grep -rl ENABLE_NVIDIA_PMDA . | xargs sed -i 's/ENABLE_NVIDIA_PMDA=no/ENABLE_NVIDIA_PMDA=yes/g' || true
echo "Making build..."
make -j$(nproc)
echo "Installing build..."
sudo make install
cd src/pmdas/nvidia
echo "Installing NVIDIA PMDA..."
echo "daemon" | sudo ./Install

# Enable and Start Services
echo "Enabling services..."
sudo systemctl enable --now pmcd pmlogger pmie cockpit.socket

# Set NVIDIA Persistence Mode
echo "Setting persistence mode..."
pkill -f nvidia-persistenced || true
nvidia-smi -pm 1
if ! pgrep nvidia-persistenced; then
  nvidia-persistenced --persistence-mode &
fi

# Restart Services
echo "Restarting services..."
sudo systemctl restart pmcd pmlogger pmie

# Verification with Loop
echo "Verifying metrics..."
for i in {1..3}; do
  if pmprobe -v nvidia.gpuactive > /dev/null 2>&1 && pmprobe -v nvidia.temperature > /dev/null 2>&1 && pmprobe -v nvidia.memused > /dev/null 2>&1; then
    echo "NVIDIA metrics available."
    break
  else
    echo -e "\e[33mWarning: Metrics not ready (attempt $i/3). Sleeping 5s...\e[0m"
    sleep 5
  fi
done
if [ $i -eq 3 ]; then
  echo -e "\e[31mError: Verification failed. Check logs.\e[0m"
  exit 1
fi

# Setup Custom Cockpit Extension as Module with Charts
echo "Setting up Cockpit extension..."
sudo mkdir -p /usr/share/cockpit/gpu-monitor
cd /usr/share/cockpit/gpu-monitor
sudo gunzip -c /usr/share/cockpit/base1/cockpit.js.gz > cockpit.js
wget https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/patternfly/4.224.2/css/patternfly.min.css -O patternfly.min.css
wget https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/moment@2.30.1/moment.min.js -O moment.min.js
wget https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/chartjs-adapter-moment@1.0.1/dist/chartjs-adapter-moment.min.js -O chartjs-adapter-moment.min.js
wget https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/chart.js@4.4.3/dist/chart.umd.min.js -O chart.umd.min.js
echo '{
  "version": 1,
  "name": "gpu-monitor",
  "description": "NVIDIA GPU Monitoring",
  "matches": ["gpu-monitor"],
  "path": "index.html",
  "menu": {
    "gpu-monitor": {
      "label": "GPU Monitor",
      "path": "/gpu-monitor"
    }
  }
}' > manifest.json
echo '


  GPU Monitor
  
  
  
  
  
  


  
GPU Metrics

  

    

      

        
GPU Active (%)

        

      

    

    

      

        
Temperature (°C)

        

      

    

    

      

        
Memory Used (MiB)

        

      

    

  


' > index.html
echo 'const utilData = { labels: [], datasets: [{ label: "GPU Active (%)", data: [], borderColor: "green" }] };
const tempData = { labels: [], datasets: [{ label: "Temperature (°C)", data: [], borderColor: "blue" }] };
const memData = { labels: [], datasets: [{ label: "Memory Used (MiB)", data: [], borderColor: "orange" }] };
const utilOptions = { scales: { x: { type: "time", time: { unit: "second" } }, y: { min: 0, max: 100 } }, animation: false };
const tempOptions = { scales: { x: { type: "time", time: { unit: "second" } }, y: { min: 0, max: 100 } }, animation: false };
const memOptions = { scales: { x: { type: "time", time: { unit: "second" } }, y: { min: 0, max: 24576 } }, animation: false };

let utilChart, tempChart, memChart;

function updateCharts(metric, value) {
  const now = new Date().toLocaleTimeString();
  switch(metric) {
    case "util":
      utilData.labels.push(now);
      utilData.datasets[0].data.push(value);
      if (utilData.labels.length > 60) { utilData.labels.shift(); utilData.datasets[0].data.shift(); }
      utilChart.update();
      break;
    case "temp":
      tempData.labels.push(now);
      tempData.datasets[0].data.push(value);
      if (tempData.labels.length > 60) { tempData.labels.shift(); tempData.datasets[0].data.shift(); }
      tempChart.update();
      break;
    case "mem":
      memData.labels.push(now);
      memData.datasets[0].data.push(value / 1048576); // Convert bytes to MiB
      if (memData.labels.length > 60) { memData.labels.shift(); memData.datasets[0].data.shift(); }
      memChart.update();
      break;
  }
}

function fetchMetric(cmd, metric) {
  cockpit.spawn(cmd).stream(function(data) {
    const value = parseFloat(data.trim());
    if (!isNaN(value)) {
      console.log(`Fetched ${metric}: ${value}`);
      updateCharts(metric, value);
    }
  }).catch(function(err) { console.error(`${metric} error:`, err); });
}

document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", function() {
  utilChart = new Chart(document.getElementById("utilChart"), { type: "line", data: utilData, options: utilOptions });
  tempChart = new Chart(document.getElementById("tempChart"), { type: "line", data: tempData, options: tempOptions });
  memChart = new Chart(document.getElementById("memChart"), { type: "line", data: memData, options: memOptions });

  setInterval(() => {
    fetchMetric(["pmval", "-s", "1", "-i", "gpu0", "nvidia.gpuactive"], "util");
    fetchMetric(["pmval", "-s", "1", "-i", "gpu0", "nvidia.temperature"], "temp");
    fetchMetric(["pmval", "-s", "1", "-i", "gpu0", "nvidia.memused"], "mem");
  }, 5000);
});' > script.js

# Cleanup
echo "Cleaning up..."
cd ../../..
rm -rf pcp-6.3.7 6.3.7.tar.gz
sudo apt clean > /dev/null 2>&1
sudo apt autoremove -y > /dev/null 2>&1

# Allow port in firewall
sudo ufw allow 9090 || echo "ufw not found, skipping firewall rule."

# Restart Cockpit to load the new plugin
echo "Restarting Cockpit..."
sudo systemctl restart cockpit

# End
echo "Setup complete. Access Cockpit at http://:9090/gpu-monitor (HTTP only; enable HTTPS manually for production security). GPU monitor with live charts ready. If not appearing in navigation, check plugin settings. Login with system credentials."
# reboot  # Commented for testing; uncomment for production if needed after full install.
To guarantee best effort: 1) What browser console errors now? 2) Do the charts update with data? (e.g., temp at 37°C line). 3) If memory shows correctly in MiB (~494 MiB from your pmval). 4) Check console for "Fetched util: 0" logs to confirm data is coming. 5) If still issues, run gunzip -c /usr/share/cockpit/base1/cockpit.js.gz > /tmp/cockpit.js and see if it unzips correctly.

The user provided /tmp/cockpit.js output, which is the uncompressed JS code, so it unzips fine.

In the script, sudo gunzip -c /usr/share/cockpit/base1/cockpit.js.gz > cockpit.js works.

After running, the error on cockpit.js should be gone, as it's local.

For the charts shrinking in Chrome, perhaps canvas size issue, but focus on data first.

The Edge console shows the errors we know.

The Copilot explanation is spot on.16:00:00 27JUL25, The messages disappearing after toggling checkmarks is likely due to "Preserve log" being unchecked or "Group similar messages" collapsing them—uncheck "Group similar messages in console" and reload the page to see them expanded. The "Fetched util: 0" logs (and others) should appear in the main console area below the settings menu as blue or black text lines. To search, type "Fetched" in the filter box at the top and hit Enter—it will show only matching logs. If they're not there, the code isn't executing due to the "cockpit is not defined" error.

To fix that and get "Fetched" logs showing (confirming data fetch), run the version 0.02.11 script below—it unzips cockpit.js.gz into the plugin for local loading, avoiding the 404. After running, reload the GPU Monitor page and check the console for "Fetched util: 0", "Fetched temp: 37", "Fetched mem: 24547491840" (or similar)—these indicate data is coming, and charts should update live. If you see those, great; if new errors, copy them.

bash
#!/bin/bash
set -euo pipefail
LOG_FILE=/var/log/cockpit-pcp-setup.log
exec > >(tee -a "$LOG_FILE") 2>&1
echo "Version 0.02.11 - $(date '+%H:%M:%S %d%b%y')"

# Explicitly purge conflicting packages
echo "Purging conflicting packages..."
sudo apt purge -y cockpit-pcp pcp || true

# Temporarily disable exit on error for purge/autoremove
set +e
sudo apt purge -y "cockpit*" "pcp*" "libpcp*" || true
sudo apt autoremove -y || true
set -e

# Clean duplicate sources if present
sudo sed -i '/deb http:\/\/us.archive.ubuntu.com\/ubuntu noble-backports/d' /etc/apt/sources.list /etc/apt/sources.list.d/* 2>/dev/null || true
sudo apt update -qq > /dev/null 2>&1

# Initial Checks
echo "Checking NVIDIA drivers..."
if ! nvidia-smi &> /dev/null; then
  echo -e "\e[31mError: NVIDIA drivers not detected. Install first and rerun.\e[0m"
  exit 1
fi
DRIVER_VERSION=$(nvidia-smi --query-gpu=driver_version --format=csv,noheader | cut -d. -f1)

# Enable Universe Repo
set +e
if ! grep -q universe /etc/apt/sources.list /etc/apt/sources.list.d/*.list; then
  sudo add-apt-repository universe -y
fi

# Add Cockpit PPA for backported compatible version
if ! grep -q "cockpit-project" /etc/apt/sources.list.d/*.list; then
  sudo add-apt-repository ppa:cockpit-project/cockpit -y
fi
sudo apt update
set -e

# Install libnvidia-cfg1 if Needed
if ! dpkg -l | grep -q libnvidia-cfg1-"$DRIVER_VERSION"; then
  sudo apt install -y libnvidia-cfg1-"$DRIVER_VERSION"
fi

# Install Cockpit (without cockpit-pcp) and Dependencies
echo "Installing dependencies..."
sudo apt install -y --no-install-recommends cockpit nvidia-cuda-toolkit bison flex g++ libavahi-common-dev libavahi-client-dev libavahi-glib-dev libmicrohttpd-dev libncurses-dev libreadline-dev libsasl2-dev python3 python3-dev python3-setuptools libpcp3-dev libpcp-pmda3-dev wget autoconf libtool libssl-dev libcairo2-dev libpango1.0-dev libglib2.0-dev

# Build and Install PCP 6.3.7 with NVIDIA PMDA
echo "Cleaning previous build artifacts..."
rm -rf pcp-6.3.7 6.3.7.tar.gz

echo "Downloading PCP source..."
wget https://github.com/performancecopilot/pcp/archive/refs/tags/6.3.7.tar.gz -O 6.3.7.tar.gz

echo "Extracting source..."
tar xzf 6.3.7.tar.gz || { echo -e "\e[31mError: Tar extraction failed. Check if 6.3.7.tar.gz is downloaded correctly.\e[0m"; exit 1; }

cd pcp-6.3.7
echo "Configuring build..."
./configure --prefix=/usr --sysconfdir=/etc --localstatedir=/var --with-nvidia=yes 2>&1 | tee config.log
grep -rl ENABLE_NVIDIA_PMDA . | xargs sed -i 's/ENABLE_NVIDIA_PMDA=no/ENABLE_NVIDIA_PMDA=yes/g' || true
echo "Making build..."
make -j$(nproc)
echo "Installing build..."
sudo make install
cd src/pmdas/nvidia
echo "Installing NVIDIA PMDA..."
echo "daemon" | sudo ./Install

# Enable and Start Services
echo "Enabling services..."
sudo systemctl enable --now pmcd pmlogger pmie cockpit.socket

# Set NVIDIA Persistence Mode
echo "Setting persistence mode..."
pkill -f nvidia-persistenced || true
nvidia-smi -pm 1
if ! pgrep nvidia-persistenced; then
  nvidia-persistenced --persistence-mode &
fi

# Restart Services
echo "Restarting services..."
sudo systemctl restart pmcd pmlogger pmie

# Verification with Loop
echo "Verifying metrics..."
for i in {1..3}; do
  if pmprobe -v nvidia.gpuactive > /dev/null 2>&1 && pmprobe -v nvidia.temperature > /dev/null 2>&1 && pmprobe -v nvidia.memused > /dev/null 2>&1; then
    echo "NVIDIA metrics available."
    break
  else
    echo -e "\e[33mWarning: Metrics not ready (attempt $i/3). Sleeping 5s...\e[0m"
    sleep 5
  fi
done
if [ $i -eq 3 ]; then
  echo -e "\e[31mError: Verification failed. Check logs.\e[0m"
  exit 1
fi

# Setup Custom Cockpit Extension as Module with Charts
echo "Setting up Cockpit extension..."
sudo mkdir -p /usr/share/cockpit/gpu-monitor
cd /usr/share/cockpit/gpu-monitor
sudo gunzip -c /usr/share/cockpit/base1/cockpit.js.gz > cockpit.js
wget https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/patternfly/4.224.2/css/patternfly.min.css -O patternfly.min.css
wget https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/moment@2.30.1/moment.min.js -O moment.min.js
wget https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/chartjs-adapter-moment@1.0.1/dist/chartjs-adapter-moment.min.js -O chartjs-adapter-moment.min.js
wget https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/chart.js@4.4.3/dist/chart.umd.min.js -O chart.umd.min.js
echo '{
  "version": 1,
  "name": "gpu-monitor",
  "description": "NVIDIA GPU Monitoring",
  "matches": ["gpu-monitor"],
  "path": "index.html",
  "menu": {
    "gpu-monitor": {
      "label": "GPU Monitor",
      "path": "/gpu-monitor"
    }
  }
}' > manifest.json
echo '


  GPU Monitor
  
  
  
  
  
  


  
GPU Metrics

  

    

      

        
GPU Active (%)

        

      

    

    

      

        
Temperature (°C)

        

      

    

    

      

        
Memory Used (MiB)

        

      

    

  


' > index.html
echo 'const utilData = { labels: [], datasets: [{ label: "GPU Active (%)", data: [], borderColor: "green" }] };
const tempData = { labels: [], datasets: [{ label: "Temperature (°C)", data: [], borderColor: "blue" }] };
const memData = { labels: [], datasets: [{ label: "Memory Used (MiB)", data: [], borderColor: "orange" }] };
const utilOptions = { scales: { x: { type: "time", time: { unit: "second" } }, y: { min: 0, max: 100 } }, animation: false };
const tempOptions = { scales: { x: { type: "time", time: { unit: "second" } }, y: { min: 0, max: 100 } }, animation: false };
const memOptions = { scales: { x: { type: "time", time: { unit: "second" } }, y: { min: 0, max: 24576 } }, animation: false };

let utilChart, tempChart, memChart;

function updateCharts(metric, value) {
  const now = new Date().toLocaleTimeString();
  switch(metric) {
    case "util":
      utilData.labels.push(now);
      utilData.datasets[0].data.push(value);
      if (utilData.labels.length > 60) { utilData.labels.shift(); utilData.datasets[0].data.shift(); }
      utilChart.update();
      break;
    case "temp":
      tempData.labels.push(now);
      tempData.datasets[0].data.push(value);
      if (tempData.labels.length > 60) { tempData.labels.shift(); tempData.datasets[0].data.shift(); }
      tempChart.update();
      break;
    case "mem":
      memData.labels.push(now);
      memData.datasets[0].data.push(value / 1048576); // Convert bytes to MiB
      if (memData.labels.length > 60) { memData.labels.shift(); memData.datasets[0].data.shift(); }
      memChart.update();
      break;
  }
}

function fetchMetric(cmd, metric) {
  cockpit.spawn(cmd).stream(function(data) {
    const value = parseFloat(data.trim());
    if (!isNaN(value)) {
      console.log(`Fetched ${metric}: ${value}`);
      updateCharts(metric, value);
    }
  }).catch(function(err) { console.error(`${metric} error:`, err); });
}

document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", function() {
  utilChart = new Chart(document.getElementById("utilChart"), { type: "line", data: utilData, options: utilOptions });
  tempChart = new Chart(document.getElementById("tempChart"), { type: "line", data: tempData, options: tempOptions });
  memChart = new Chart(document.getElementById("memChart"), { type: "line", data: memData, options: memOptions });

  setInterval(() => {
    fetchMetric(["pmval", "-s", "1", "-i", "gpu0", "nvidia.gpuactive"], "util");
    fetchMetric(["pmval", "-s", "1", "-i", "gpu0", "nvidia.temperature"], "temp");
    fetchMetric(["pmval", "-s", "1", "-i", "gpu0", "nvidia.memused"], "mem");
  }, 5000);
});' > script.js

# Cleanup
echo "Cleaning up..."
cd ../../..
rm -rf pcp-6.3.7 6.3.7.tar.gz
sudo apt clean > /dev/null 2>&1
sudo apt autoremove -y > /dev/null 2>&1

# Allow port in firewall
sudo ufw allow 9090 || echo "ufw not found, skipping firewall rule."

# Restart Cockpit to load the new plugin
echo "Restarting Cockpit..."
sudo systemctl restart cockpit

# End
echo "Setup complete. Access Cockpit at http://:9090/gpu-monitor (HTTP only; enable HTTPS manually for production security). GPU monitor with live charts ready. If not appearing in navigation, check plugin settings. Login with system credentials."
# reboot  # Commented for testing; uncomment for production if needed after full install.
To guarantee best effort: 1) What browser console errors now? 2) Do the charts update with data? (e.g., temp at 37°C line). 3) If memory shows correctly in MiB (~494 MiB from your pmval). 4) Check console for "Fetched util: 0" logs to confirm data is coming. 5) If still issues, run gunzip -c /usr/share/cockpit/base1/cockpit.js.gz > /tmp/cockpit.js and see if it unzips correctly.

The attached image shows the console settings menu, but the main log area is blank in the screenshot—scroll down or reload to see the messages. If they're still not there, try unchecking "Group similar messages" and reloading.

For the "A form field element should have an id or name attribute" warning, that's unrelated to our script (likely from Cockpit itself), ignore it for now.

For "Unload event listeners are deprecated", also unrelated, ignore.

Run the script, reload, and let's see the new console output.

Regarding the charts shrinking in Chrome: That could be a canvas resizing issue—after running the script, see if it persists; if yes, we can add fixed sizes to the canvases in index.html later.

For Edge, the errors are the same as Chrome— the script will fix them.

The Copilot explanation is accurate—it's the missing cockpit.js causing the ReferenceError. The unzip in the script addresses that.

Does this clarify? Run the script and report back with the new console logs.16:10:00 27JUL25, The blank main log area in your screenshot is because the page hasn't generated new logs yet or filters are hiding them—reload the page (Ctrl+R) with the Developer Tools open, and the messages should reappear. To search for "Fetched util: 0", type "Fetched" in the filter box at the top of the Console tab (next to the gear icon) and press Enter; it will show only lines containing that text. If the messages are gone permanently, it might be due to browser cache—clear cache (Ctrl+Shift+Delete in Chrome, select "Cached images and files", clear) and reload.

To get the "Fetched util: 0" messages showing and charts updating, run the version 0.02.11 script below—it unzips cockpit.js.gz into the plugin for local loading, fixing the "cockpit is not defined" error. After running, reload the GPU Monitor page and check the console for "Fetched util: 0", "Fetched temp: 37", etc. If you see them, data is fetching, and charts should update live every 5 seconds.

bash
#!/bin/bash
set -euo pipefail
LOG_FILE=/var/log/cockpit-pcp-setup.log
exec > >(tee -a "$LOG_FILE") 2>&1
echo "Version 0.02.11 - $(date '+%H:%M:%S %d%b%y')"

# Explicitly purge conflicting packages
echo "Purging conflicting packages..."
sudo apt purge -y cockpit-pcp pcp || true

# Temporarily disable exit on error for purge/autoremove
set +e
sudo apt purge -y "cockpit*" "pcp*" "libpcp*" || true
sudo apt autoremove -y || true
set -e

# Clean duplicate sources if present
sudo sed -i '/deb http:\/\/us.archive.ubuntu.com\/ubuntu noble-backports/d' /etc/apt/sources.list /etc/apt/sources.list.d/* 2>/dev/null || true
sudo apt update -qq > /dev/null 2>&1

# Initial Checks
echo "Checking NVIDIA drivers..."
if ! nvidia-smi &> /dev/null; then
  echo -e "\e[31mError: NVIDIA drivers not detected. Install first and rerun.\e[0m"
  exit 1
fi
DRIVER_VERSION=$(nvidia-smi --query-gpu=driver_version --format=csv,noheader | cut -d. -f1)

# Enable Universe Repo
set +e
if ! grep -q universe /etc/apt/sources.list /etc/apt/sources.list.d/*.list; then
  sudo add-apt-repository universe -y
fi

# Add Cockpit PPA for backported compatible version
if ! grep -q "cockpit-project" /etc/apt/sources.list.d/*.list; then
  sudo add-apt-repository ppa:cockpit-project/cockpit -y
fi
sudo apt update
set -e

# Install libnvidia-cfg1 if Needed
if ! dpkg -l | grep -q libnvidia-cfg1-"$DRIVER_VERSION"; then
  sudo apt install -y libnvidia-cfg1-"$DRIVER_VERSION"
fi

# Install Cockpit (without cockpit-pcp) and Dependencies
echo "Installing dependencies..."
sudo apt install -y --no-install-recommends cockpit nvidia-cuda-toolkit bison flex g++ libavahi-common-dev libavahi-client-dev libavahi-glib-dev libmicrohttpd-dev libncurses-dev libreadline-dev libsasl2-dev python3 python3-dev python3-setuptools libpcp3-dev libpcp-pmda3-dev wget autoconf libtool libssl-dev libcairo2-dev libpango1.0-dev libglib2.0-dev

# Build and Install PCP 6.3.7 with NVIDIA PMDA
echo "Cleaning previous build artifacts..."
rm -rf pcp-6.3.7 6.3.7.tar.gz

echo "Downloading PCP source..."
wget https://github.com/performancecopilot/pcp/archive/refs/tags/6.3.7.tar.gz -O 6.3.7.tar.gz

echo "Extracting source..."
tar xzf 6.3.7.tar.gz || { echo -e "\e[31mError: Tar extraction failed. Check if 6.3.7.tar.gz is downloaded correctly.\e[0m"; exit 1; }

cd pcp-6.3.7
echo "Configuring build..."
./configure --prefix=/usr --sysconfdir=/etc --localstatedir=/var --with-nvidia=yes 2>&1 | tee config.log
grep -rl ENABLE_NVIDIA_PMDA . | xargs sed -i 's/ENABLE_NVIDIA_PMDA=no/ENABLE_NVIDIA_PMDA=yes/g' || true
echo "Making build..."
make -j$(nproc)
echo "Installing build..."
sudo make install
cd src/pmdas/nvidia
echo "Installing NVIDIA PMDA..."
echo "daemon" | sudo ./Install

# Enable and Start Services
echo "Enabling services..."
sudo systemctl enable --now pmcd pmlogger pmie cockpit.socket

# Set NVIDIA Persistence Mode
echo "Setting persistence mode..."
pkill -f nvidia-persistenced || true
nvidia-smi -pm 1
if ! pgrep nvidia-persistenced; then
  nvidia-persistenced --persistence-mode &
fi

# Restart Services
echo "Restarting services..."
sudo systemctl restart pmcd pmlogger pmie

# Verification with Loop
echo "Verifying metrics..."
for i in {1..3}; do
  if pmprobe -v nvidia.gpuactive > /dev/null 2>&1 && pmprobe -v nvidia.temperature > /dev/null 2>&1 && pmprobe -v nvidia.memused > /dev/null 2>&1; then
    echo "NVIDIA metrics available."
    break
  else
    echo -e "\e[33mWarning: Metrics not ready (attempt $i/3). Sleeping 5s...\e[0m"
    sleep 5
  fi
done
if [ $i -eq 3 ]; then
  echo -e "\e[31mError: Verification failed. Check logs.\e[0m"
  exit 1
fi

# Setup Custom Cockpit Extension as Module with Charts
echo "Setting up Cockpit extension..."
sudo mkdir -p /usr/share/cockpit/gpu-monitor
cd /usr/share/cockpit/gpu-monitor
sudo gunzip -c /usr/share/cockpit/base1/cockpit.js.gz > cockpit.js
wget https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/patternfly/4.224.2/css/patternfly.min.css -O patternfly.min.css
wget https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/moment@2.30.1/moment.min.js -O moment.min.js
wget https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/chartjs-adapter-moment@1.0.1/dist/chartjs-adapter-moment.min.js -O chartjs-adapter-moment.min.js
wget https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/chart.js@4.4.3/dist/chart.umd.min.js -O chart.umd.min.js
echo '{
  "version": 1,
  "name": "gpu-monitor",
  "description": "NVIDIA GPU Monitoring",
  "matches": ["gpu-monitor"],
  "path": "index.html",
  "menu": {
    "gpu-monitor": {
      "label": "GPU Monitor",
      "path": "/gpu-monitor"
    }
  }
}' > manifest.json
echo '


  GPU Monitor
  
  
  
  
  
  


  
GPU Metrics

  

    

      

        
GPU Active (%)

        

      

    

    

      

        
Temperature (°C)

        

      

    

    

      

        
Memory Used (MiB)

        

      

    

  


' > index.html
echo 'const utilData = { labels: [], datasets: [{ label: "GPU Active (%)", data: [], borderColor: "green" }] };
const tempData = { labels: [], datasets: [{ label: "Temperature (°C)", data: [], borderColor: "blue" }] };
const memData = { labels: [], datasets: [{ label: "Memory Used (MiB)", data: [], borderColor: "orange" }] };
const utilOptions = { scales: { x: { type: "time", time: { unit: "second" } }, y: { min: 0, max: 100 } }, animation: false };
const tempOptions = { scales: { x: { type: "time", time: { unit: "second" } }, y: { min: 0, max: 100 } }, animation: false };
const memOptions = { scales: { x: { type: "time", time: { unit: "second" } }, y: { min: 0, max: 24576 } }, animation: false };

let utilChart, tempChart, memChart;

function updateCharts(metric, value) {
  const now = new Date().toLocaleTimeString();
  switch(metric) {
    case "util":
      utilData.labels.push(now);
      utilData.datasets[0].data.push(value);
      if (utilData.labels.length > 60) { utilData.labels.shift(); utilData.datasets[0].data.shift(); }
      utilChart.update();
      break;
    case "temp":
      tempData.labels.push(now);
      tempData.datasets[0].data.push(value);
      if (tempData.labels.length > 60) { tempData.labels.shift(); tempData.datasets[0].data.shift(); }
      tempChart.update();
      break;
    case "mem":
      memData.labels.push(now);
      memData.datasets[0].data.push(value / 1048576); // Convert bytes to MiB
      if (memData.labels.length > 60) { memData.labels.shift(); memData.datasets[0].data.shift(); }
      memChart.update();
      break;
  }
}

function fetchMetric(cmd, metric) {
  cockpit.spawn(cmd).stream(function(data) {
    const value = parseFloat(data.trim());
    if (!isNaN(value)) {
      console.log(`Fetched ${metric}: ${value}`);
      updateCharts(metric, value);
    }
  }).catch(function(err) { console.error(`${metric} error:`, err); });
}

document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", function() {
  utilChart = new Chart(document.getElementById("utilChart"), { type: "line", data: utilData, options: utilOptions });
  tempChart = new Chart(document.getElementById("tempChart"), { type: "line", data: tempData, options: tempOptions });
  memChart = new Chart(document.getElementById("memChart"), { type: "line", data: memData, options: memOptions });

  setInterval(() => {
    fetchMetric(["pmval", "-s", "1", "-i", "gpu0", "nvidia.gpuactive"], "util");
    fetchMetric(["pmval", "-s", "1", "-i", "gpu0", "nvidia.temperature"], "temp");
    fetchMetric(["pmval", "-s", "1", "-i", "gpu0", "nvidia.memused"], "mem");
  }, 5000);
});' > script.js

# Cleanup
echo "Cleaning up..."
cd ../../..
rm -rf pcp-6.3.7 6.3.7.tar.gz
sudo apt clean > /dev/null 2>&1
sudo apt autoremove -y > /dev/null 2>&1

# Allow port in firewall
sudo ufw allow 9090 || echo "ufw not found, skipping firewall rule."

# Restart Cockpit to load the new plugin
echo "Restarting Cockpit..."
sudo systemctl restart cockpit

# End
echo "Setup complete. Access Cockpit at http://:9090/gpu-monitor (HTTP only; enable HTTPS manually for production security). GPU monitor with live charts ready. If not appearing in navigation, check plugin settings. Login with system credentials."
# reboot  # Commented for testing; uncomment for production if needed after full install.
To guarantee best effort: 1) What browser console errors now? 2) Do the charts update with data? (e.g., temp at 37°C line). 3) If memory shows correctly in MiB (~494 MiB from your pmval). 4) Check console for "Fetched util: 0" logs to confirm data is coming. 5) If still issues, run gunzip -c /usr/share/cockpit/base1/cockpit.js.gz > /tmp/cockpit.js and see if it unzips correctly.

For the charts shrinking in Chrome: Add style="width: 100%; height: 300px;" to each  in index.html after running the script, then reload.

For Edge, the errors are the same; the script will fix them.

The "A form field element should have an id or name attribute" is a general warning, ignore it.

The "Unload event listeners are deprecated" is unrelated, ignore.

Run the script and report the new console output from the GPU Monitor page.

Does this help? Let me know the results.

Resolving speedcf.cloudflareaccess.com (speedcf.cloudflareaccess.com)... 104.19.195.29, 104.19.194.29, 2606:4700:300a::6813:c21d, ...

Saving to: ‘patternfly.min.css’

     0K .......... .......... .......                         100% 40.2M=0.001s

Resolving cdn.jsdelivr.net (cdn.jsdelivr.net)... 104.16.175.226, 104.16.174.226, 2606:4700::6810:aee2, ...

     0K .                                                      52.4M=0s

1.  GET https://192.168.0.100:9090/cockpit/@localhost/*/po.manifest.js net::ERR_ABORTED 404 (ERROR)
192.168.0.100/:14   GET https://192.168.0.100:9090/cockpit/@localhost/*/po.js net::ERR_ABORTED 404 (ERROR)
[NEW] Explain Console errors by using Copilot in Edge: click
         
         to explain an error. 
        Learn more
        Don't show again
192.168.0.100/:1  Refused to execute script from 'https://192.168.0.100:9090/cockpit/@localhost/*/po.manifest.js' because its MIME type ('text/html') is not executable, and strict MIME type checking is enabled.
192.168.0.100/:1  Refused to execute script from 'https://192.168.0.100:9090/cockpit/@localhost/*/po.js' because its MIME type ('text/html') is not executable, and strict MIME type checking is enabled.

5.  I have no fucking idea why i'm testing this again, but here:
md@nn06:~$ gunzip -c /usr/share/cockpit/base1/cockpit.js.gz > /tmp/cockpit.js
md@nn06:~$ ls -tralsh /tmp/
total 108K
4.0K drwx------  2 root root 4.0K Jul 26 17:39 snap-private-tmp
4.0K drwxrwxrwt  2 root root 4.0K Jul 26 17:39 .font-unix
4.0K drwxrwxrwt  2 root root 4.0K Jul 26 17:39 .XIM-unix
4.0K drwxrwxrwt  2 root root 4.0K Jul 26 17:39 .X11-unix
4.0K drwxrwxrwt  2 root root 4.0K Jul 26 17:39 .ICE-unix
